text:
I've been looking for a good Jewish Deli since I moved to Las Vegas. I picked up a friend from the Airport and he told me that we had to try this deli, so off to Bagelmania we went. 

When we walked in (around 11am) it was pretty busy. There were only a few open tables, and we were promptly seated. We ordered the whitefish salad appetizer and it was GREAT. I haven't had smoked whitefish salad like this since I lived in Chicago. Served with a bagel or your choice, and dill pickles, it was all very tasty! Paired with a Dr. Brown's Black Cherry soda, how could you go wrong?!?!?!?! 

Next came the Lox, Eggs, and Onions, served with Home Fries. Just like grandma used to make (jk). The servings are a good size and the atmosphere is very casual. The bagels are the best bagels I've found in Las Vegas. My friend ordered some Rugala to go to snack on in his hotel room later on. We had to break into it just to have a taste and they were very good. 

They have all kinds of meats, cheeses, salads, and desserts available for quick carry out. If you're looking for a great Authentic Jewish Deli in Las Vegas, this is the place to go. They are open 7 days a week, but only until 3pm.
go to this place! It has such great breakfast  the bagels seem homemade and everything was incredible. It's "closeish" to the strip, but not on the strip. The breakfast was huge!
What a lovely little gem. Perfect for a quick to go meal on the way to the Grand Canyon. Food delicious and service perfect. Even filled our camelbacks!
Really enjoy coming here for breakfast! The food is excellent. Delicious bagels, and excellent matzah ball soup. My husband enjoys the brisket sandwich.

Many of their dishes are made from scratch, ingredients are generally-speaking fresh. Best nova lox you can get without going to a high-end eatery. Essentially you are going for the food and nothing else. 

Service and prep are ABYSMAL. As my party puts it, "there is an issue every time." The customer will principally deal with this middle-aged, portly blonde woman that works the counter who is weary of her surroundings, humorless, and completely devoid of personality. I have yet to be waited on by anyone else. It takes her forever to ring up an order, details need to be confirmed and re-confirmed to ensure she's understanding you, and sizes/portions may still be wrong. She is not proficient with the credit card swiper and seems borderline offended that anyone would even vaguely consider paying that way. Suggestions emerge as gentle nudges, pushing you into food specials that actually cost more to the customer thanks to their portioning. When you get your food, assuming you ordered a bagel, the cream cheese is slathered on so haphazardly that its spread is reminiscent of the Ocean Spray logo. You actually need to re-do the work of the line cook and spread it again. 

Prices are disgusting. $10-15 after taxes for a bagel and lox (more expensive than NY, NY which is FAR better). $2.60 for a 10-12 oz beverage. Fountain drinks? Obligatory largest size. Good luck fitting it in your cupholder. Come on.

Great Jewish deli, but be forewarned: they are not open for dinner. Great bagels, bialies, kugel and chopped liver. Extra laudits for the bagels and sweet kugel, which was awesome! They even sell fresh schmaltz! Everything I've eaten here is good except for the cabbage borscht. It tasted like something schlocked together from various canned food. Avoid!

Bagels that rival the ones in LA and NYC.  Only a few blocks east of the Strip.

Places like this are a vanishing breed; see the 2014 movie Deli Man.

Bagels are crusty on the outside and thick and chewy on the inside.  Standard selection of onion, poppy, salt, sesame, pumpernickel, etc.  Bialys too.  

I had mine with cream cheese and sliced tomato, and they were perfect.  

My kids had the omelette and bagelwich, both of which were generous.  Sandwiches later were good too.

Other baked goods were great, particularly the mini challah and the chocolate chip mandelbot.

Staff was friendly.

Will have to return.

Hole in the wall bagel shop that seems to have been plucked off the streets of queens ny circa 1968.  Stuck in time perfectly.  Great New York style bagels lox and all the trimmings. No lookers here and if you're under 30 you'll likely be half the age of most of your fellow diners.  Come for the food and ignore the demilitarized zone neighborhood.   One of the best breakfasts and values in Vegas.

I eat here about three or four times a year, breakfast and lunch.  The prices are moderate for the amount and quality of food - it is Vegas.

The CB hash is always good and the daily specials, especially the chicken-in-a-pot are good.

Take some of the cookies home with you and a bag of bialis.

If you cannot tell nova from cosco lox, do not bother. If you like real, NY bagels, good deli, big portions and friendly service, try this family run place. Run as it was 20 years ago, no frills, just good food. What a concept!

I am not a die hard bagel fan but no one is talking about Harrie's super sandwiches.  They have the best egg salad I have ever bought.  The white bread must be fresh baked as it is sooo soft and they are thick sliced.  The triangle sliced sandwich is huge!

But wait , , , , there are pickles!!!  The absolute best home made dill pickles in the world!  No jar of pickles will ever be good enough for me after having theirs!

In another life, I was probably born Jewish. I went through a phase growing up when I was obsessed with bagels, lox, etc. Hell, I even studied the violin for 13+ years. Harrie's helped reunite me with my long lost (and imagined) Jewish identity while i did my stint out in LV.

Harrie's, as others have said, is a tradition in LV. For me, it was a Saturday morning late breakfast with either their hash or 2 eggs sunny side up all served with a warm toasted bagel of your choice and some cream cheese on the side. The coffee wasn't the best, but who cared? I was sitting here for a chance glimpse of the Elvis impersonator driving up in his silver Chrysler Sebring. It's more about the ambience here. This is old Las Vegas, folks. Good hearty NY style deli food with cheery people who love the city and treat the customers right.

Yes, they make their own bagels. When you go towards the back, you'll see the bags of flour and the mixing machines through the kitchen doorway. And they make a killer bialy too. The prices are good too. There's a breakfast special on the weekdays - can't recall how much, but it won't run you more than $5 for 2 eggs any style, some meat, a bagel and a coffee. Why sit in a generic Denny's or Blueberry Hill restaurant when you can just relax and feel at home here at Harrie's?

5 stars for ambience and service, 3.5 - 4 stars for food. I like the bialy the best. Reconnect with your love for bagels...and give Harrie's a try. If you see Elvis, take a picture for me. Thank you, thank you very much.

This  is a very good Jewish style deli.  Finding a decent bagel outside the NY area has been a challenge. My husband tried chicken in the pot. The portion was very generous, and came with a matzoh ball and kreplach. I ordered a bagel and lox. The bagel could have been softer, but the nova lox was very fresh and high quality. The egg cream was very authentic, and one of the best I've ever had. The service was very good. Our waitress was friendly and the owner checked to see if we were enjoying our food. If you are looking for a quick bite for lunch or breakfast, I would recommend this restaurant.

I am afraid to tell anyone else about this place as then it will be too busy and the prices will be raised - but I also want them to stay in business as i just bought a house in vegas. East Coast - the real deal. try it once - you'll be back. Do not go for the ambiance - in fact - get take out. It's just the best.
We love bagels - get them at Einstein's every week. This place does bagels right. Creamy whipped cream cheese with lots of great fresh bagel options. Really good eggs and bacon too.

If you are in Las Vegas and headed to the Convention Center make an effort to stop at Harrie's Bagelmania.  This little deli is a nice change from the glitz and glamour of The Strip.  Many locals stop by here for breakfast and lunch.

I was in the area recently.  I took the RTC city bus route 108 from McCarran Airport.  For $2, the bus will wisk you to Harrie's in 10 minutes.  It's in a little strip mall on the corner of Swenson and Twain.

Despite being a deli, they offer sitdown service.  One entree that I enjoyed was their Three Fer plate: knish, potato pancake and a blintz.  It comes with sour cream and apple sauce on the side.  On my recent trip, I had the kasha knish.  They also offer a knish with potatos or meat.     

I would definitely return for breakfast and lunch.  The staff is friendly and food was fresh.  As their name implies, they have a host of bagel combinations.  They do close at 3pm.

I live on the westside and drive across town for this. It's never empty for a reason. While the lady at the counter seemed kurt, she was very helpful. At first I thought she was aloof, but when I asked for a bagel sliced, she told me that they charge for that and was I sure because even she thought that seemed unnecessary. I appreciated that. They are always kurt but helpful. And the salt bagel and bialy are the best. They even have the best cream cheese. If you can't tell the difference, you may be satisfied with other places. But if you are a true bagel snob, this is the place! Cash only though!
Great service and great value .  Mish Mosh soup was outstanding.  I just wish they were open in the evenings.

This place is awesome.  went there super hung over from an epic night and the food is perfect.  Awesome breakfast potatoes, bagel sandwiches with egg, cheese, and whatever meat you want.  They have it all. Its close to the strip.

Not a ritzy place at all - the ATM gives you a receipt and you have to get your cash at the front desk!??

Price is legit though - you can have a full breakfast for $10 easily
I love bagels and this place has the best!! The pumpernickel bagel is my favorite. You must try the apple cinnamon cream cheese!!

The bagels were average, didn't think there were anything that blew me away. Although the "natives" in the neighborhood would probably blew me away if I made eye contact with them. Even the waitress gave us attitude when we tried to pay with credit card. I suspect the place is part of a "front" for the mob for money laundering, hence the cash only policy.

Friendly service, reasonably priced breakfasts that don't skimp on the ingredients, big portions, plates that will make you think the Saved By The Bell theme is gonna start busting out at any time... This place was a straight up oasis from the usual Vegas "experience restaurant" overkill. Excellent bagels. You can tell the restaurant has been around since the bagel craze of the 80s, but when you're facing your Fourth Day In Vegas killer hangover, that can be very soothing. It's just a good place serving good food. No pretensions, no BS. Plus the waiter happily sent me on my way with a free to-go cup of coffee, a gesture I usually only see in expensive hotel restaurants. Not the kind of place you need to feel obligated to drive across town for, but if I lived within 5 miles of this place, I'd go there all the time.

Good bagels, decent service, good portions. Corned beef hash was a major disappointment. Flavorless and mushy. How is it possible to make corned beef flavorless? Even salt and Tabasco didn't help. If it's homemade, they need to start from scratch. If it's from a can, they need a new supplier. I never send food back unless it's undercooked, but if we hadn't been on the move, I would have returned this for something else.

Pretty good bagels, and good overall breakfast.  I liked the fact that it was a deli and had a large menu.  However, the bagels were a little denser and not quite what I'm used to.  We have an Einstein's here that I really like, and I guess that's what I've come to expect.  Harrie's may be more traditional, but I didn't like them quite as much.

We're Jews from NY, and these are the best bagels we've had in Vegas. Felt like a bagel shop in NY. Good prices, and they have a dozen bagels for $5.50 every Tuesday. If you don't like these, keep going to your suburban imitation bagels spots. This place is for people who can appreciate an awesome bagel.

I'm from the east coast and am a bagel SNOB! This place is wayyy out of my way but is definitely hands down the best bagel in Vegas! I got the garlic bagel w/ scallion cream cheese... Mmmm :) I will definitely be back!

For over 30 years we've enjoyed mornings of great food,  great friends, great times!! 

Highly recommended to anyone who wants the best "double-bagels" anywhere. 

Enjoy!

I love it, my first time here was great, my family and I are from California,  we came down to visit family and they told us about this place. Well we alll love it, my kids had pancakes and cereal, I had a wonderful Turkey bagel, my husband had a delicious bagel to. I recommend this place (:

The owner, Old lady is a real grouch  does NOT understand the meaning of Customer is always right.     A customer asked for something in a certain way,  She refused and said NOPE and rather to throw people out of her store.  The request was a very simple  to have the sable in a bagel,  She said NO  we do not place sable in a bagel  it is always served on the side  period.  It was a take out order to go to the airport!  

The cooks was willing to do what customer wanted but the owner said NO  we do not do that, she does not even care about if a customer is happy or not!    a true GROUCHY old Lady!  

If you want a very pleasant service and SMILING faces,  go to the Bagel Cafe off Buffalo ave.  MUCH MUCH better service and people are smiling!

They CLAIM to be true New York Style place,  I am from NEW York and grew up in various bagel environment  and that place is crapoloa!

The service was impeccable. The food came out so quickly and the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  I've been to 5 star restaurants where the service wasn't as good.  Definitely coming back for breakfast.  The food and bagels are top notch too!

Having been to Bagelmania in the years past,  I was completely underwhelmed.  The rye bread, pastrami & store - bought swiss  cheese was average at best. Relatively small quantities of both products. We arrived at 12:30 Noon to an absolutely empty restaurant. During the 1 hour of our lunch there was only one other sit down lunch customer. After our $34.+  2 sandwich 2 glasses of tea lunch we realized we;  "had been taken to the cleaners"  It is sad to witness the end of a truely wonderful Las Vegas institution.  Thanx for all the old memories...

Been coming here for years love the corned beef sandwich beats every other place in town. 

Also the service has always been spot on. I try to make here as often as possible. If you go on Tuesdays they have their specials going on.

So I got really excited about there being a "Jewish" deli over by where I live, as I've been missing that style of food since moving to Vegas from Los Angeles.  It really was an old-timers place, the kind where people have been going there for years and the waitresses know your names.  I was probably the only person in the place under 40.  I liked the feel, and the food was decent, I had the corned beef hash.  I've had better, but on the whole the meal was perfectly acceptable.  However what got me was the bill, $19 with tip for corned beef hash with a potato pancake and a cup of iced tea.  For that price I could've gone to the Stage or Carnegie Deli on the strip and gotten what would probably have been better food.  Will I come back here, probably, since I get that food craving every now and then.  And be forewarned, bring cash, they don't accept credit cards.
Just come here to get a great bagel. This isn't your crappy bagel like einstein bagels. These are homemade. Cash Only.

Moved to Vegas from New York almost seventeen years ago. One of my main concerns was where to get my bagel fix. From the first time that I set foot into Bagel Mania I knew that I had found a home.Consistently good. Breakfast or lunch. All the basics done right. Excellent place for lunch especially because the home made soups are excellent. If you like bagels the old fashioned and authentic way, DIS BE DA PLACE !!!!

Best bagels in town. No contest.

Loved this restaurant! The bagels were delicious; the meat knish was phenomenal; and, the service was very warm and attentive. I gave four stars instead of five because they do not have a credit card machine and I had to use their ATM machine in order to pay my bill. However, that did not take away from the quality of the food or service at Harrie's. Will definitely eat here again the next time I am in Las Vegas!

Just visiting Vegas and found Harrie's on Yelp. It was just as advertised: a great local spot in the ghetto with delicious breakfast bagels and a deli. The place was full of regulars that the employees knew by name, a nice change from being with all the tourists on the Vegas strip. I had an "everything" breakfast bagel with egg, bacon, and cheese. It was hot, perfectly toasted and yummy. Coffee was not bad, not the best I've ever had but decent and served in nice blue mugs. The service was fast and friendly. And they had an awesome New York mural on the wall to look at while we ate. They take cash only so plan ahead. Definitely going back to check out the deli next time I am in town.

The waitstaff at Bagelmania is friendly and hardworking. The food is okay but expensive for Vegas. Two people should plan to spend $35-40 for a regular breakfast. The real problem is the restaurant itself. It needs a complete remodel or they should relocate. If you're ODC like me, a visit to the restroom will ruin your appetite. There's one tiny dingy unisex restroom located not far from the kitchen with poor ventilation. The seating area of the restaurant is old, but well lit and clean. The back near the restroom has narrow hallways, is darker and feels dirty. I'll only go back if they renovate and clean it up. Overall the place is overrated.

They have the best bialys and bagels ever.  After breakfast my husband and I took home chopped liver, a kasha knish, and creamed herring.  When we asked for extra onions in the herring the owner told the cook to weigh the herring first then add the onions so we wouldn't be charged more for the addition.  Very nice.  We will definitely be back for more.

I went to Harries exactly four times since moving to Las Vegas. The fact that it is in a ghetto is scary, even in daylight, but the reward of a good bagel made me forget about the neighborhood. Each time I went there, I took advantage of the Tuesday special. The first time they only had three ET's (my favorite), so I had to add a few others to round out the dozen. I was told that you can get exactly the mix you want if you call on Monday. So I call on Monday and order 12 Whole Wheat ET bagels. They said that this was a special order and I would have to prepay it (cash). I was told I would still get the Tuesday special price. So my wife drives 30 minutes to prepay the special price and is informed that it is a special order and the Tueday price does not apply. She then drives 30 minutes back home. I drove on Tuesday to pick up the order and asked why I was required to pay the normal price, because 'special orders' are not included in the special price, that is their policy (even though their facebook page say ALL bagels are cheaper on Tuesday) .
Okay, That is their policy. I am new in town and I must learn these things. The third time I ordered 9 Whole Wheat and 3 Bialys. The WW bagels were good and I added my own 'everything mix' to them. The bialys were rolls shaped like real bialys with a dab of onion in the center, nothing like Kossar's Bialys!

The fourth time I placed an order the owner took my order, name and phone number, as was usual. What was unusual is that they did not have the order ready when I got there, so I just told the clerk, "just give me 12 Whole Wheat". She opens the bag and is intercepted by the owner who says, "No bagels for him". The owner then tells me she has the right to refuse service to any undesirable customers. "I refuse service to you. Goodbye" I asked why and she said I insulted her help (which I would never do).

I left, never to return. If she wanted to refuse service to me, why did she take the order? She could have saved me an hour trip. She wanted to inconvenience me. She is a very mean woman who offered no evidence of my behavior except her word. Enjoy the bagel place in the ghetto.

The food here is excellent. I could tell the bagels were made fresh and the cream cheese was delicious. I got the hoppel poppel, which was an extremely large amount of food. I recommend splitting that between two people. The portions are large in general so come hungry. Our server was extremely nice and took good care of us. My only complaint is that half of our food came out 20 minutes before the other half of us got our food. Overall this is an excellent place for bagels and breakfast.

Loved this place!

Been to vegas for a conference and early morning was starving for some warm bagels and coffee. Harrie's Bagelmania was just the right place. Good location. Close to the strip. Cozy deli and warm service. 

We had the Jalepeno bagel and french toast. Both arrived quickly and were delicious. I loved the fact that all their cream cheeses are lite. Our server was very warm and prompt. 

The only negative was that the billing was very old fashioned. We had to give the lady our email address or phone number to get a copy of the receipt. Sort of dated that way. Other than that we had a wonderful experience and came back the next day for more :)

Second stop in search for the best Pastrami. IMHO. 
Had the pastrami on Rye. Although all was fine with the sandwich, I was a little disappointed with the amount of meat. I wanted a little more for the almost 11.00 dollar meal. You do get a little apple sauce and potato pancake, but I could have done away with that for a meatier sandwich. Oh well, the search continues.
Another bit of NY in the desert. Easily best bagels and lox in Vegas. Go for the "Burton 1-2-3-1" very good. Orange juice is fresh squeezed and coffee is good.
A little pricey except for the Bagelwich (the best deal in all of vegas)!  But it is all really good and a great neighborhood breakfast and lunch joint.

The Real Deal.  Real bagels - no shortcuts - at least 15 kinds.  And all the traditional toppings/spreads.  Bialys. All kinds of sandwiches, salads, soups...  Made from scratch.  Noodle kugel with raisins!  3 kinds of knish - kasha (outstanding), potato, and meat (I've only had the kasha).  Fried matzo, blintzes, potato pancakes...  Lox, nova, kreplach, schmaltz - all available here.  All of the regular breakfast offerings plus a million choices for lunch.  Super-friendly people! (thanks Nancy!)  They also cater.
Open daily 6:30 am to 3pm.
Within walking distance of The Strip.  Just say No to nasty casino rubber bagels and GO HERE.

So very few choices for a real bagel in Las Vegas. I'm not even referring to a real "NY" bagel which is subject to interpretation. A bagel is a specific bakery item that needs to be baked according to that recipe. This place and maybe one other does just that. It also happens to be a great NY style bagel so I like it that much more!! Everything always fresh and made to order.

Love love love this place! I came for the first time last month, and I've been here 4 times since! I l've only had a bagel sandwich but it's wonderful! Thinking about heading over to day, and try some of their other items.
Fun place - nice to get away from the strip for a while. Good bagels, though the coffee was so weak it could have passed for tea.
This is one of the best hidden gems in Vegas. REAL waterbagels! The only little Jewish deli in town. I love coming here. The waitstaff is great. My only wish was that it was open later in the day.

The bagels where great. The service was not. We waited closed to 20 minutes in a nearly empty restaurant for our bagels. Just bagels. Toast them. Bring them to the table. That's it. We also waited for menus. Then waited for the check. Then waited to pay. Bring something to read and enjoy the bagels!

If you are looking for a wide variety of halva this is the place.  They had a whole wheel of marble as well as 6 different kinds of Joyva.  Great lox, cookies, cream cheeses and of course, bagels.  Get a dozen on Tuesdays for $5.99.  A great place to recall a by-gone era.

thanks fellow yelpers for a great find. was looking for something casual and quick for breakfast and didn't want to have to hunt for parking at a casino restaurant. plus, i'm always on the lookout for a good bagel, so harrie's came up on my search.

pretty big menu of deli/diner selections, lots of omelets, scrambles, sandwiches, salads, soups, etc. i had the corned beef hash and eggs, which came with breakfast potatoes and a bagel w/cream cheese. food was served piping hot and was outstanding. hash was tasty and not overloaded with grease as can happen.

had an onion bagel, tasted as "east coast" as i've had on the west coast. for a frame of reference, my favorite ny bagels are h&h... not sure how native new yorkers would rate those, but i love 'em. absolutely hate noah's bagels. can't wait to dig into the plain (always a measure of how good a bagel joint is) and the bialy i brought home.

highly recommend harrie's for a casual, off strip breakfast or lunch with a decidedly local flavor. i'm disappointed i hadn't heard of this place sooner... it will be a must visit whenever i'm in lv. 

as others have noted, the neighborhood is a bit dodgy, but i wouldn't let that stop me from visiting. cash only.
So glad to have found this place! Reminds me of a place you'd find in New York, small family owned and delicious! I had coffee and a ham egg and cheese bagel sandwhich. Definitely worth a try!

Somebody erase my browser history because I have died and gone to heaven.

This is a true New York Style deli. Generous portions of lox and cream cheese on fresh homemade bagels melt in your mouth. Grumpy old men with newspapers and the hint of old school Las Vegas make this place a must try. 

Close enough to the Strip for tourists but far enough away for a local crowd too. Prices are more than fair.

Had a late breakfast here, and I've got to say I'm a fan now. The Reuben Omelet is absolutely amazing! The fact that it's not in one of the nicest places in town shouldn't deter you from giving this hidden gem a shoit.

This place is my go-to for breakfast especially on weekends when I want to sleep in til at least 9am..If you can even call that sleeping in. (Conveniently, 9am is also when breakfast locations on the strip begin to get busy with tourists so I like to avoid those places like the plague)

If you are a bagel lover, then come here because they have the most amazing bagels of every kind. My personal favorite is the toasted everything bagel. Even better.. a toasted everything bagel with cream cheese and nova (less salty version of lox, equally as delicious).

Since I come here just about every weekend now, I've settled on some personal favorites and routine breakfast items that I will order: the chicken in a pot (chicken noodle soup with your choice of a dark/white meat portion of chicken, meat kreplach, and a matzo ball) -- chicken noodle soup in general is so basic but it is so delicious and packed with flavor here! It is a Saturday special only, but i make sure to come on Saturdays just so I don't miss out. My other favorite item is the meat knish which my bf loves as well (we used to order 1 for the both of us but now my gluttonous self demands a whole thing for myself)-- not sure how else to explain what this is, but it is similar to an empanada with ground meat. Sounds boring,  but the texture and flavor has me addicted!

This delicatessen isn't in the best area, but it is a must try. The food is great, and the service as well. It isn't your typical fancy breakfast location on the strip, but it isnt a generic IHOP either!

Mindblowing.

That is the word for this fantastic breakfast joint waaay off the old and hackneyed Vegas Strip. Freshly made bagels, tasty cream cheeses, and lots of coffee... what else do you need to start off your day?

If you happen to be a freak and don't like bagels, Harrie's also serves tons of other breakfast dishes, from eggs to pancakes to french toast. I can't speak for those because I devoured half their bagels over two breakfasts there.

Bonus points for friendly service - I left my phone on the table and one of the wait staff came over and handed it back to me as I was leaving.

For a full year i make the drive from mountains edge to the eastside ( office bldg next to Lindo on DI ) - sometimes i take the 215/airport route, other times the 15 / spring mtn ; During that time i drove by Harrie's at least 100+ times and i never tried.

I move to my westside office last month and now i've tried harrie's twice ... go figure

first visit - standard breakfast - 3 eggs over, sausage patties, everything bagel toasted.  solid - priced a little on the high side given the zip code but overall, i like the place.

2nd visit - lunch - get the turkey/pastrami/swiss and thousand island on rye with the mac salad ( homemade ) - again, decent sammie - a little pricey for what you get ( $11.50 ) and for the mac salad being "homemade" it sure had that bucket-o-salad taste to it.

If i'm in the area and need some breakfast or lunch, i'll definitely re-visit.

pics added

What an awesome place...Top quality food..you'd think you were eating in a deli in Chicago..The reuben omelet is to die for..the saurkraut is like no other i've ever tasted and the eggs taste so fresh...plus the portions are HUGE...DEFINITELY my first choice to eat every day... Prices are well priced...People there are friendly...

Reading the reviews for Harrie's Bagelmania really makes me wonder if I ate at the same place as everyone else! I went there based on reviews from Yelp but had the opposite experience. 

I thought the bagels were about as good as grocery store bagels i.e. doughy and bland. I was hoping for real deli food like good pickles and potato salad but the potato salad was worse than the bagel. My travel companions were equally disappointed. I ordered lox cream cheese on a sesame bagel and if I had not been so hungry, may have given it away. 

Also, the woman behind the counter left our bagels sitting on the counter while she helped several other people who were ordering. By the time they shouted our order, my brother was done with his bagel and mine was cold. 

I also don't favor places that use styrofoam and to go packaging even when you're eating there. I would not go here again despite my desire to support mom and pops over chain restaurants.

Being from new york I was so excited to eat breakfast here this morning but if your Black do not expect a Warm greeting or hospitable service, the waitress was sooo dull no smile she almost seemed annoyed to serve my friend and I but the second a group of white people came in she was super nice to them. She never asked how was the food or did we need anything, or if we were done , she brought us the check and basically was telling us to leave , never asked if I wanted more coffee or anything, this has to be the worst dirtiest place ive ever been? To in my life!

This is a great deli to eat at in LV. The food is always fresh and of quality. Since I discovered this hidden jewel several months ago it's been a frequent eating stop; never had a bad meal. The deli bagels are the best and deli product is great! A must come to place to eat!

This place is like a real, authentic Jewish deli...according to my husband who is a Jewish boy from New York. Best bagels in Vegas. Dine in food is also excellent. We are Californians who come to Vegas 6 times a year and stop here for bagels every time.

The best bagels outside of NYC. Under new management and the food and Service are outstanding!!!! 
Plenty of free parking, and very easy to find.
A great Las Vegas hangout for both locals and visitors !!!

great breakfast! spot 

especially if you in a rush 
this spot worked out perfect for my employees and i before our convention

Ya know.. there's something just kind of special about stopping over at Harrys  for a bagel. 
An excellent delli with an eclectic crowd something similar to a feel that you might find in New York City.
The neighborhood is sketchy but the parking is super close
The bagels to me are absolute perfection, some may  disagree with but for me, the best in town. Harrys has kept me coming back for 20 years . 
There is no reason to come here other than enjoying the atmosphere and the food. Oh that's right what else is there. :) People watching!

Sooooo disappointed...

Let me set up our story:
I am a lover of NY knish...yep even the square ones you can find at a dog stand. And hubby is Jewish from SF. First generation American.
Together we are a dangerous bagel seeking, knish seeking, lattke seeking pair of weirdos. I guess we expect the lattkes to be like his 90 year old grandmas and the knish to resemble something his Israeli family could whip up. Bagels? I guess we expect ones you can find in SF and NY.

This place has none of the above.

The service was bad from the get go and I ignored it because I was excited to find a place like this.

I immediately ordered a knish to start with and it came...huge...weird old dough and skin on chunky potatoes inside. It seemed microwaved. And I kept tasting it and trying to find hints of caramelized onion or leeks...nope...some onion powder at most.

Next I ordered a potato pancake (as they called it) and of course we expected a lattke. Nope. Seemed also microwaved and it looked like my old college day salmon patty I used to whip up and bake. Basically it was the texture of a ground veggie burger. 

Ok. Now for the bagels. Hubby ordered egg whites and tomato on a garlic bagel. I ordered Nova and an everything bagel it came platter style with cream cheese, red onion and tomato. His bagel was hard and it had dried garlic flakes on it. My everything bagel (I requested non toasted) was also hard and seeds and flakes were burnt on the top.

We sat in silence and I ate my room temperature Nova and he ate half his sandwich. The server lady kept giving me the stink eye and I thought I was just imagining things but hubby said something when we went to the car lol.

So for the crappy coffee and stale food that we took mere bites of...we paid our $32 bill plus a tip at 9am and never looked back.

Honestly, I guess we just expected waaaaay more than day old tasting items. 

*sadface*

This place isn't bad. It has traditional breakfast and bagel food and has apparently been a staple to the area for a while. Personally I wasn't impressed. The fresh squeezed OJ was ok, The Nova and eggs was very salty. The bialy wasn't great (had others in town much better). The corned beef hash I had wasn't bad. All in all it was fair. Only thing I wanted seconds on was the coffee.
We love Harrie's, when we are on the eastside we will frequent Harrie's. Just plain old fashioned no frills good food. Everything on the menu is excellent.

Bagels, Bagels, Bagels. Terrible name, great bagels! This is a little family owned Jewish Deli. The food is pretty good but the bagels is where it's at. Closest thing to NY bagels that I have found in Vegas. Real, boiled, NY bagels with great cream cheese's and many other hard to find kosher items. If you like the mom and pops places then this is a great place. Make sure you bring cash because they don't take plastic here.

Harries probably has the best bagels and cream cheese I have ever had. They are fresh bagels baked right in-house. I would say that this is definitely a hole in the wall, it is not in the best part of town in Vegas but it is quite worth the trip for a good breakfast. 

I had the apple cinnamon bagel with the cinnamon cream cheese and it was a great pair. The cream cheese wasn't too sweet either (as I've tried their strawberry cream cheese = MY FAVE before). I know that when I go to Einstein bagels or something, the cream cheese is extremely sweet. This place has it in moderation so you get the best of both worlds of a hint of sweet and the cream cheese flavor. 

The bagel quality makes this place get 4 stars-- not 5 because of the horrible service we had. 

The lady that took our order and served us was NOT enthusiastic at all. 
When she handed our meals, she did not even repeat what we got, she literally just placed it on our table and walked away. 

I was astounded at how someone could STILL work in a restaurant with that kind of attitude. Vegas is known for their hospitality and maybe that lady was having a bad day? 

Who knows. 

Regardless the quality of Harrie's bagels are a must-try.

BEST BAGELS IN VEGAS. 

This is the only bagel place I've found with fresh salted bagels. If you haven't tried them, you need to! The breakfast specials are amazing. Great eggs, a bagel with fresh cream cheese (nothing philly about it!), bacon, and home fries for a great value. I like to add a side of fruit too.

Be sure to get there early Sunday mornings; the bagels fly out of the bins! Try the bagel sandwiches: salted bagel, fresh eggs, bacon, and cheddar--my boyfriend always wakes right up when I bring these home. 

Lox? Incredible. Cookies? Fantastic. Service? Unbeatable. I forgot my wallet once and offered to leave my phone as collateral while I drove home. The cashier was so sweet. She told me she couldn't let me drive without a phone for emergencies. Be sweet to these people. Trust me, we want them to stick around! 

Now they're able to accept credit cards, even though the bagels have always been worth carrying cash for.

These guys are Tribe members and know their stuff. Support your local Jewish Deli dude (and Italian, German etc) and keep the quality alive. These fake deli chains stink! Their bagels are fresh made err'day and they really care about quality. I wad impressed by their Salt bagel especially. Yum!

I'm sad writing a one star. Rairly happens. But I just need to be honest. Place was dirty. The matzo ball had no flavor. The bagel that came with it almost broke my tooth. The potato pancake was very greasy. The applesauce tasted canned. Pastries were very good. Service was good. Bill came out to $36 counting tip for my girlfriend and I. Cute place but for that price, I'll be going somewhere else next time. Thank you.

We loved it here!  Was the best Matzo Ball soup, Rubens, and bacon in Las Vegas!  New ownership as of January so time will tell if they can keep up the quality.  Service this morning was lacking and we had to remind our waitress to provide silverware, the accompaniments for the potato pancake and refill our drinks.   Food was okay...  rubens we're a little more greasy than before.  We're willing to give it another try...  bagelwich was its usual excellence.

Harrie's continues to be a staple in my Las Vegas breakfast life! I've watched family come and go(sadly) but the memories stay the same! Great Food, Good Friendly Service! And QUALITY! Keep up the good work!!

I swore I would never review Harrie's Bagelmania (correctly spelled) but since the secret is out, I will give them the props they deserve.  I wanted to keep my secret place empty for myself.

This is by far the best breakfast I have in Las Vegas....even better than the Maple Tree which is very yummy.  It is a dumpy little place in a half-deserted strip mall in a so-so part of town but the food is good....really good.  All the egg dishes are yummy/  They understand bacon well done better than anyone.  I'm not a big fan of their pancakes but most people like them.  I love the bagels...yummy, heavy, proper bagels. 

 I have been coming here for 15 years.  Every time I go to Vegas I go to Bagelmania.  I brought a party of 10 one Sunday morning and they sat us right away in the back.  Everybody at the table loved it.  That is unusual to get 10 folks to sign off on a place. The service is always appropriate.  They won't wow you with being overly friendly, but it is prompt and attentive.

I highly recommend Harries for breakfast....but in 15 years, I have never had lunch there.  Try it once.  You will probably like it.

We unknowingly showed up with about 30 minutes before closing and were the only customers there. The staff didn't seem annoyed (as can happen when you come in just before closing) and the service was very good. The food was delicious and very authentic...unlike the chain bagel restaurants. We'll be back next time we're in town.

Incredibly fresh and delicious food!!! Ok, it's not in the best area of town, but nonetheless it IS Zagat-rated. And it's convenient, even to visitors. It's on Twain, the road that runs between Wynn/Encore and Venetian/Palazzo, and it's not too far from them, maybe about a mile to the east. 

Just yesterday, I had two of the most delicious everything bagels, toasted, covered on top with crispy onions. And I had them with jalapeno cream cheese. There was so much yummy cream cheese, dripping out all sides, that I had to finish the cream cheese up off the plate using a fork.

And for this prices were very reasonable, about $3.25 per bagel with cream cheese.

The menu is quite reminiscent of a NY Jewish deli. In the past I've had pastrami sandwiches, chicken salad sandwiches, tuna fish on bagel, corned beef sandwiches, potato salad, cheesecake. All delish. And you can take deli meats home by the pound or bagels home by the dozen. The current Tuesday special is, I believe, a dozen bagels to-go for about $6.50.

This is semi-old-school Vegas. It's been in place since 1992 when the original & former owner Mort moved it here from a ritzy suburb of Chicago. 

Open at 6:30am and closed by 3pm most days. Authentic, incredibly delicious and very fair prices. If you are anywhere near, try it out!

Been here several times before it is a true staple of this side of Vegas Anthony was fabulous waiter very pleasant and fun the food isn't anything to really scream about if you're a local and a regular than you love it

I miss Jewish delis in LA. Nate and Al's, Brent's Deli, Canter's, etc.

This is THE closest thing. 

I stopped in one morning when I was craving a heavy breakfast. I got the everything bagel with nova and cream cheese. 

For the first time in my life, I had a choice between Lox and Nova. If you don't know the difference, google it. 

The Nova and Lox are priced per lb, and its a bit pricey, but who cares. You get what you pay for.

I am glad this place is down the street from my office. I'll be back!

I am a sucker for a good bagel and after 4 days of convention food and all you can eat buffets, a simple, delicious breakfast was my desire.  It took me years to try this place.  Last year it was good and this year, again, it was a terrific break from the trade show grind, and just a half mile from the convention center.

In addition to the bagels, which were great, I tried the $10 Hoppel Poppel.  It's a mix of breakfast foods:  scrambled eggs, hash browns, salami, green peppers and onions.  The serving was gigantic and easily shared.  

Harrie's Bagelmania is at the kind of off the strip, locally owned restaurants I love to find on trips to Vegas.

Smoked salmon spread was chock-ful of smoked salmon.
Bagel fresh, tasty, and full of sesame seeds.
Super friendly service -- gave us complimentary samples of whitefish and baked salmon salads.
And honestly the best black and white cookie of my life.  It's going on my Vegas rotation.

I have never written a bad review on Yelp - this will be my first one. 
I have been coming to Harries Baglemania for about 10 years now, every April.  It was the first great Jewish Deli that I found in Las Vegas.  In my most recent trip, I saw that the old woman was no longer at the place.  I placed a simple order - a bagel lox and cream cheese, and a chicken soup - both always fantastic from Harries Baglemania.  Upon arriving back at my hotel, I discovered that there was no lox on the bagel, but lox spread.  I drove back to Harries, and they apologized, and replaced the sandwich.  Upon return to the hotel, we discovered that they were not using Nova Lox, but very salty plain lox (smoked salmon) which did not taste good (and was certainly not traditional).  In addition, the chicken soup was not using a real boiled chicken. I could clearly see that there were "chicken cubes" that looked like prepared chicken from a food service, as opposed to "grandma boiling up the chicken in the back of the store".   The fact that Harries was (and still is) a dump is part of the charm, if you are familiar with the old NY Jewish Deli's in New York (there are no "nice looking" real NY Deli's - they were all dumps, all built from struggling families) - but unfortunately, the "love" in the preparation of the food is no longer there. It's just a business for someone new.  With places like Bagel Cafe, and Canters both in Las Vegas, I will unfortunately be bringing my business elsewhere in the future.

Much like the Bagel Café on the west side of town, Harrie's serves bagels and deli classics in an old-school diner-style setting. Portions are generous and good-quality product results in surprisingly high prices: my bagel sandwich with lox set me back an absurd $15. I will say that it was loaded with a lot of lox, but maybe normal portions and prices would be more appealing... Other than that, the bagel itself was underwhelming, toasted to a hardness that was difficult to bite into, and just wasn't particularly flavorful aside from the toppings.

Bagels are available in individually or in bulk, toasted or not, with or without schmear and other toppings. Shop only offers choices of regular or scallion cream cheese. Potato pancakes, knishes, blintezes, and other Jewish deli staples available as well as meats by the pound. I still prefer BC, but this isn't a bad option if you're on this side of town.

I took a stroll down memory lane this past weekend (Yes, it was homecoming at UNLV) and ate here last Monday.  Old Mort is on that cloud in the sky now, but the memories are still there at Bagelmania. Yes, 'tis full of old East Coast Jews in the morning, and the breakfasts are served by the same 'ol fuddy-duddy women who served me as a young kid from San Francisco years ago.  I had the specials, which consisted of bagel, sausage, and three eggs.  I took two of my pals who happened to be celebrating homecoming as well.  We spent $24 on coffee and the specials.  All was served efficiently.  Same rude service, but mind you this place was packed early in the morning.  So head to that 'ol strip mall on Twain and Swenson in the 'hood, and grab yourself a special (if you read the RJ, don't clip the coupon.  It's an advertisement) and a toasted onion bagel.
Hit this little shop, really more of a deli/diner than a straight bagel shop. I had amazing matzo ball soup and an ok sandwich. Coffee was fabulous. I will be back next time i go through town.

Great bagels, best I've ever had!  This is not your chain store bagel shop, and it doesn't disappoint. If you're in Vegas and you don't want to spend a fortune on breakfast at the Bellagio, take a drive off strip and grab a bagel. Buy a loaf of authentic Jewish rye to take home too, its awesome!

I went here after reading all the Yelp reviews.  I don't understand all the rave reviews.  Nothing special AT ALL.  I ordered a pastrami omelet.  (Don't let that fool you... they do not have a giant selection of omelets, although you could specify ingredients to create a custom dish.)   When the plate arrived, I looked down to see a rather large portioned omelet that was stiff, fairly hard, smooth sided, compacted and in the shape of a triangle.  I immediately compared it to the looks of a tan colored cranberry scone.  There was no evidence of a yellow or egg whites.  It was all overcooked and brown.  If it wasn't for the triangular shape i'd say it looked like it was baked too long in a shoe.  yes, the texture while eating it was exactly as it looked.  Rubbery and flakey. Brown.  The omelet came with a bagel and diced potatoes.  The bagel:  Nothing special AT ALL.  It's not like you are going to Einstein's bagels or anywhere of that caliber.  It was not extra tasty or extra large.  I was surprised at that for a bagel shop!!  I usually love hash browns or other types of breakfast potatoes.  Not this time.  These diced potatoes were mushy and sticky in a weird kind of way.  Like warmed mashed potatoes that were cubed, and that stick to the roof of my mouth like peanut butter, but not as bad as peanut butter.  it was just weird. I'm sure that this was the first time in 30 years that I did not finish my breakfast potatoes.  It was only after I got my bill that I found out that the cheese that my waitress suggested ("what kind of cheese do you want on your omelet?) that I found it that the cheese was $1.50.  I wouldn't have ordered the cheese at all if I had known it was extra.  Here is what breakfast cost me (for myself):  Pastrami omelet:  $10.99, cheese: $1.50, Milk, 20 oz:  $2.75.  With tax my total bill was $16.48 not counting a tip.  If the pastrami omelet was not the most expensive item on the menu, it was right up there.  So yes, you could very easily get your entrée $3 cheaper.  I would not recommend this place, because although it was unusual to have an pastrami omelet, it, and the rest of the meal, did not taste special at all.  I wish I had explored elsewhere.
Bagels were outstanding (best in Vegas). Wait staff was solid. Eggs were horrible (tasted like imitation eggs). Order accordingly.

Seriously... Jewish Delis are a significant point of weakness for me. Fresh bagels. Ridiculous portions of food that should never been mixed together or consumed in one sitting. Especially for breakfast! 

Harrie's is no exception. Hot coffee coming right up- you will eat to content and from a smorgasbord of delectable homemade options. If you eat here all you will say on your way home from Vegas is, Oy Vey! Who needs a buffet?!
Food here is great . Some of the best tasting Bagels on this side of the US. Bialys are also awesome. We come here to eat every time we go to Las Vegas

If you go here, don't expect anything special.  It's very much an average Las Vegas eatery, which means it's below average if you're from the real world.  I guess if you've only had Vegas bagels, this could be a 3-star, but I'm being very generous.

It's not authentic, and it does not have a great menu offering.  The food they do offer is very bland, and simply below average. 

Make sure you have some time to spare.  The wait can be very long, and the staff is almost purposefully slow.
i have only tried the bagels and bagel sandwiches here and i go back weekly.  enough said :)

This place is awesome, it's not a tourist spot for sure. Mainly locals come here. I come here with a big group of people every morning for a week during SEMA, this place is great fro breakfast. We always call ahead to reserve a table and they always make rood for us and the service is quick and friendly. Can't go wrong with the breakfast special.

Terrible management 
The new managers spends his time bragging and catering to his friends.
While 20 year plus clients wait and watch as more his friends came and we sat waiting for a bowl of soup 
38 minitues later we left while others sat with menus in their hands
Weiss deli is the place to go!

Close by the Las Vegas Convention Center, it is as close to New York style bagelry you'll see in Vegas.

We stopped for breakfast-

- I ordered pumpernickel bagel with side of whitefish and cucumbers 
- Two colleagues ordered fried egg and bacon sandwiches
- 2 more colleagues ordered bagels with cream cheese and Lox

Everyone enjoyed their food! And prices were reasonable compared to hotels and casinos. We noticed local law enforcement officers there too so it is also a locals hangout.  I would definitely come back when back in Vegas for a conference.
Love this place been going there for years it was perfect fit lunch in between classed when I was at UNLV. Best bagels in town.

Classic New York-style bagel place nestled in the heart of the ghetto on Twain Street. (take your gat with you!)

We order breakfast from here, for my work, when we have large meetings.  Everyone always requests this place and we order the simplest thing:

-Bagel Breakfast Sandwich: egg, cheese (some sort of meat: bacon, sausage or ham) on a plain bagel.  That is it!

The eggs is cooked perfectly: like a fried egg and the yolk is just barely runny so all the flavors of the egg, cheese, meat and bagel dance on your tongue.  YUM!

Believe this: this sandwich is even good COLD!  We had lots of leftovers and people were eating them for lunch cold.  Cold egg?  Uh yeah, its good on this sandwich.  (I would NEVER eat a Egg McMuffin cold, but this shiz is for real!)

Their bagels are exactly what I look for in a bagel: moist, a little chewy and delicious flavor.  I have only had the plain bagel and if its that good, I can only imagine how good everything else is.

(after i ate two halves: one for breakfast and one for lunch, I gained 2 pounds, but I think it was worth it!!)

Nancy (who I think is married to the owner??) is a doll and always makes sure everything is perfect.  We ordered from here last week:
30 bagel sandwiches and a fruit bowl.  They cut the bagel sandwiches in half and I swear everyone ate at least 3 halves!  The total was around $193 (included tax and delivery) and she took a check.

Now this is hearsay, but a lot of the people in my office have come here for breakfast and have said how they INHALED all of their food, because its that good!

If anything, go here for a bagel breakfast sandwich or bagel and cream cheese and you will be addicted!

This place used to be great under the previous ownership.  Sad to say it has changed hands and has gone downhill . It's filthy and they are trying to figure out how to make a chefs salad and chicken soup with no chicken ! Go to bagel cafe instead . It's a 15 minute Drive at the most ! Great amazing deli food ! Buh-bye Bagelmania

Omg! The Ruben omelette was straight up bomb.com! If you are a Reuben fan, then this is the omelette for you! I got it with pastrami and loved it. It's also served with corned beef. 

The staff is super friendly too. :)

Harrie's Bagelmania is a great little breakfast place, in an area of town you would want to generally stay away from, except Harrie's is in a shopping plaza.  It's a Jewish inspired menu, and the bagels are easily the best I have had in Vegas.  Also, on Tuesdays, they sell a dozen bagels for dirt cheap...I think maybe $5?

This morning I had the breakfast special of 3 huge eggs, fried perfectly, a slab of ham, a mound of hash browns, and a sesame bagel.  We also got a potato pancake - I'm not a connoisseur of potato pancakes, but Harrie's are awesome.

Service is pretty good, but they always make sure your coffee or iced tea are filled.  

Plan ahead, because Harrie's is cash only.

I thought I would not find a great bagel place in Las Vegas but my husband's friend, Uncle Bert, recommended us this place. Thanks Uncle Bert. They make matzah brei for breakfast here. My husband ordered his with salami and I had bialy and fresh lox. The lox was "goodly-fresh" and bialy was a match. Our waitress was friendly and knew ahead what we needed to go with our meals. Matzah brei was ok but I'd prefer without the salami. The portion of the brei was quite big. The price is not that cheap for people in the area (I think) but I guess the place is for tourists? Not sure. But lox is not that cheap everywhere either. K, enough complain! *:)
Nice and simple. Lots of bagels and spreads to choose from and even some breakfast dishes. Located in an abandoned mall but not far from the strip.

What can I say, Harrie you did it again! This is the second time I have dined on Harrie's as close as it gets to the east coast bagels on the west coast, well in Las Vegas at least. From potato knish to pumpernickel bagel Harries has me all vacklempt. Crisp on the outside soft on the inside, slight bagel chewyness without giving you lock jaw. O' what a bagel. It has been a long time since I had an everything bagel, and harrie you brought me back in time to old New york school days of my usual everything bagel breakfast. These bagels even hold up for a few days so order a dozen. Shalom harrie!!

Terrible service. They offered me fruit as a side then came back and said they had no fruit, they offered me cottage cheese, then came back and said no cottage cheese. I got so frustrated by their lack of knowledge I said I was just gonna go somewhere else so then they said well we already charged your card. They gave me a hand-written receipt for my charges instead on a printed one and said my credit would get to me "when the owner gets around to processing her charges" no definitive time or date given. So now I have no meal and I have no idea when I'm getting my refund if at all. This place is run terribly AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!

I've been coming to Harrie's for over 20 years and we haven't been in a few years since it had seemed to go down hill.  We were in the area and went for breakfast a few weeks ago and it was great, just like the old days!  Def try breakfast here and the bagels are the best in town!  Go for the bagels and lox, not the service!

Came in ordered the burtons 1231 which is lox I had it with a garlic bagel cream cheese red onions! Was one the best I ever had! Friendly staff! Order came right up! Nice and clean! Will come again! Loved it!

The food is very tasty and quite plentiful.
This is now going to be a regular stop when ever I come to Vegas.

They have Yelp & Zagat rating stickers on the window, which can be intimidating for anyone, walking into a business. I was recommended to come here from a writer in Las Vegas. I ordered the Matzoball soup & Turkey Club with potato pancake and apple sauce.

The matzoball soup was hot and large in a good amount of liquid. I'm used to having chicken noodle matzoball soup, so this was a change. For the price, avoid ordering it plus something else.

The turkey club sandwich was tasty. I ordered it with toasted wheat bread. The sandwich came out so large that I was almost not able to fit my big mouth around it. This is a sandwich for which I would return to this restaurant to eat again.

Some of the charm of this restaurant are the people who work there, mainly the waitresses. They'll tell you straight up what is really going on and make sure you order food that you will enjoy. I have not tried the dessert here yet. Visit for the sandwiches and the authentic type deli.

We love bagel cafe, but moved to the other side of town and needed a legit bagel spot. We don't like the crap at chains like Einstein's-- their bagels aren't chewy and their cream cheese is not great (just for reference). After searching Yelp! we decided to check out Harrie's. 

We ordered a breakfast sandwich with egg, cheese, and bacon on an everything bagel in addition to a blueberry bagel with strawberry cream cheese and took our order to-go. Service was quick and friendly (we were helped by the owner herself!) and our order didn't break the bank. The bagels were delicious! We've since returned and ate-in, enjoying another breakfast sandwich on a jalapeño bagel and an everything bagel with plain cream cheese. We're going back for a third time this morning.

I would argue that for a bagel place, there are limited bagel options, but the options are good. If it ain't broke, don't fix it! Harrie's has been here for 25 years for a reason.

Love love LOVEEEEE Harries,I mean from the fresh baked bagels to the exceptional tasting Bialys I guarantee that you cannot go wrong with this place! Having years & years of experience with the way that they present fresh breakfasts and lunches,Bagelmania certainly doesn't disappoint! The neighborhood of course could use a little TLC,but I can assure you that it has absolutely no comparison to the restaurant and its staff. Everyone here is always so nice to me please do yourself a favor and stop by soon,you will NOT regret it.

This place was fantastic, I would have given it 5 stars except for without any notice about a year ago (it has been a while since i last went as i dont frequent vegas much) they changed their cabbage soup recipe. It used to be the BEST cabbage soup i have ever had in my life. It was the reason I went here. It was thick delicious tomato goodness with the best cabbage ever. Now it is the most bland disgusting watered down garbage ever. I have not been here since and do not plan on going back. I actually asked the chef who makes the soup and he said they made him change the recipe for whatever reason and he agreed he liked it better before too. I asked one of the hostess too and they said it was because a customer complained it was too thick or something.
I could eat here every day.  It is that damn good.  The meat omelette meal was massive and delicious to the last bite.  See you soon!

The worst! My mother has eaten here before and thought it would be a nice place for a mother daughter breakfast date. My mother even said she would go to this place just for their coffee.

After this morning, We will never set foot in this establishment again. I would have recommended it before to friends and family but not after this morning.

I ordered the 3 eggs with I thought the hash browns and a side of fruit.
My mom ordered the BLT with a side of hash browns and extra mayo.

I received my eggs and a cup of fruit, when I asked where the hash browns were the waiter informed me that he substituted them with the fruit. I said I wanted the hash browns with a side of fruit. We told him we had no problem paying extra for the hash browns. 

My mother went to eat her hash browns and they were so salty, you wanted to ask if the lid fell off when seasoning the hash browns. Her sandwich consisted of a slice of tomato, one piece of lettuce and about 6 slices of bacon. No mayo... there was a cup on my plate with what looked like mayo (turned out to be butter). 

Then came the tipping point, after eating my eggs (still didn't have my hash browns) I found a light colored hair buried in my fruit cup, of which I only ate 3 grapes. We both lost our appetite. Asked the guy for our check. He brought it over. Okay I ate most of my food so yes I should be charged, my mom barely took a bite out of her food. And they charged us $27.20. With what we ordered that is a very reasonable price. We didn't have a problem with the cost at all. However, the fact that my mom hadn't touched her food was another story. 

So we went up to the registrar to talk to the Nancy. She told my mom that well she played with her food, so she has to pay for it. And I quote "Those who complain about the food complain about the price". Again nothing is wrong with their prices. So I asked if they charged extra for the hair in my fruit. She said there was no hair in your fruit. If their was it was your. Okay, so I have brown almost black hair and my mom has auburn hair. Neither of us have light hair. However, When I informed her that it was light colored, she said no one who worked their had light colored hair (guess she never looked in the mirror). 

So in the end we paid almost $30 for 3 eggs, toast and two cups of coffee.
I've been coming here for years... You have to try the pastrami... Get it on and everything scooped bagel.... The food is great... The people are even better... Food is just awesome...

Every year I come to Vegas for a convention and eat at this great little restaurant. It is off the beaten path but well worth it for value & price. I order their special for $7+ gets you 3 eggs, 3 pieces of meat, potatoes & bagel & cream cheese. Their bagels are legit and many choices. They are the real deal.

Each time we come to Vegas, this is a must. Today I had the BLT on sesame bagel, excellent! They put so much bacon on it I couldn't keep it on the sandwich. The wife had their tuna on onion bagel, her moans of deliciousness was a testament to her enjoyment of the sandwich. She said it all when she stated-"everything looks so good, we need to come here every day. "
Old school bagel shop in Vegas. Great food and great service. Will be coming here a lot going forward.

Day one, I had an everything bagel with lox cream cheese. Delicious. Second day had the corned beef hash with a breakfast bagel. Day one was better than day two, but we are comparing greater and great.

Don't let the exterior appearance fool you. This place has been making everything from scratch for 21 years. This will be a regular visit every time we come to Vegas.

Awesome place.... Soooo underrated!!! Staff is amazing and friendly... Being from NYC it's really hard to find a good bagel out here! But this places shines through that.... By far the best bagels in Vegas. Always fresh, always delicious!!!! I promise you won't be disappointed with this place!!!!

Super cheap & super awesome breakfast! They really know how to do breakfast right here, with super huge portions and fresh hot breakfast. My friends and I ordered food from here to-go and brought it back to our hotel to eat. We couldn't believe how much food we got! 

I ordered the 3 eggs with potatoes meal combo. It came with your choice of bagel or toast. I got the Jalapeno bagel with butter, and it was super delicious!! It`s even better because it was close by and has lots of parking :) 

The waiters and waitresses are so nice and helpful. 

A must visit if you`re looking for a cheap breakfast place and not feeling like buffets.

Discovered Harrie's when searching for bagels in Vegas and was super happy about it!  We headed in to grab breakfast and bagels and it was a great experience.  Breakfast was good, but the star was my bagel!   It is so hard to find REAL bagels and the egg bagel i had at Harrie's was the real deal!  SO HAPPY!  SO SAD I DON'T LIVE IN VEGAS!

So, the decor is bizarre and the place is kind of old and odd, but the staff is friendly and helpful and the service is fast and the food is good.  Then, pick up bagels and cream cheese on your way out for tomorrow.  I will absolutely be back and I've been telling everyone to go!

Now, thanks to Yvonne, I'm dying to try the egg salad and the pickles!!!

GO HERE.

I ate here yesterday.  I had a bowl of matzo ball soup and a pastrami sandwich.  The sandwich was good.  I have been here many times .  I loved the soup.  However this time the soup tasted like a bowl of water.  I was shocked.  I do not know who is making there matzo ball soup, I hope this place improves there soup.

I always stop into Harry's when I need my Jewish Deli Fix. It's much close to me than Bagel Cafe and quite frankly almost as good. Today I stopped in for a Roast Beef & Cheddar on an Onion Roll. Everything is made from scratch, sliced roast beef, fresh baked roll, and the coffee is always fresh. You seat yourself and the waitress come over promptly and the food comes out quickly. I've had the pastrami breakfast plate as well and it's amazing. Fresh bagel and cream cheese for sale in ten way out which is a plus. It's not in the best neighborhood but it's not really that bad either. Definitely with the stop

Love this place!!! The staff (family owned) are so friendly and personable. The food is amazing, especially the bagels. Nice, quaint bagel shop, where locals and regulars come. The neighborhood seems kinda sketchy but I promise you this is a place you gotta go to eat.

Extremely slow service.tuesday morning after ten.not even crowded.by the time I got my oatmeal, it was cold with old mushy bananas.my bagel was easily a day old and so stale and chewy I couldn't eat it, it hurt my jaw to chew.this place is awful, I'll never be back

In the most bizarre strip mall along crack alley is where you will find Harrie. I get to drive through here everyday on my way to work, so I've become familiar with Harrie over the years. I boycotted for about 7 years but recently started coming back because I was sick of Einstein's. 

I love an everything bagel, and what I love even more is when "everything" is on both sides of my bagel. I found that here. Problem is, their bagels are really hard. Really, really hard. My usual spread is onion & chive. I find their spreads here are really thin, if you were to hold the bagel to on the side, it would slide off. I tried the Lox spread and it was so incredibly salty, I ended up throwing it away. What I do love is the cookie case. I've tried them all, and they are all pretty damn good. 

Also I think their prices are a little steep, $3.78 for a bagel & cream cheese (did I really just complain about prices for a Jewish deli)? Yes, I did.
Amazing food.  Im from the east coast living in Arizona.  Went to vegas and found this gem!  They are from Chicago so you know their deli food is good!

I just left Harrie's and I inhaled a delicious lox and cream cheese on a bagel. I'm from NY and I am very particular about the heavenly rings of yeasty goodness. To my relief, these bagels were delicious! Everyone was nice and I was very happy with the super friendly customer service. 
So, to that yelper -Hollie C. below, you are an insane racist and your review is disgusting.

This former New Yorker gives the puffy luscious bagels a two thumbs up and monstrous knish an A++ for it's perfectly seasoned russet potatoes and tan flaky dough. Brings me straight outta Brooklyn- my childhood :-)

Real pumpernickel bagels!  Heaven. 
This place is open only for breakfast and lunch, but I go for breakfast when I have a chance because it reminds me of the deli of my childhood, Shapiros of Indianapolis, when I go there then.
Although it is not as great as it was when Harrie was alive [he died a few years ago], Harrie's widow lovingly keeps his restaurant and his deli alive.
Go first thing in the morning and you will see a cross-section of the real Las Vegas -- politicians, cab drivers, general folks -- enjoying a good meal.
It is worth it just to go for the "show."  It has a real deli feel to it.  Something which is missing in other better known Las Vegas delis.

I used to go here all the time. I am not going back ever again. They did not have coffee. Place is gross. Took forever to get menu's, took forever to get a soda. It was so slow. The 2 girls and some guy were more interested in talking to each-other. The cook was laughing bc the food would just sit up there and they were so slow in taking food to tables. There were only 6 tables. The guy gave my wife syrup, and said if u need more let me know.

No one ever came back to check on us so we couldn't get more soda or syrup. What a disaster. It took us over am hour. That place used to be in and out in 25 mins. Place sux
Excellent deli short drive from the strip. Salami and egg breakfast was excellent. Bagels are top notch. Please note cash only. Update they now take credit cards via 4square.

This place has won awards, had to try it. You do have to drive through a bad part of town but it is worth it. The staff are friendly, nice and helpful. The food is outstanding!!

The breakfast plates, bagels and kugel all taste great, the price is reasonable, and the breakfast plates are large portions.

I visit this whenever I am in Vegas, even if I have a free breakfast somewhere else, I will go here.

Definitely a wide selection of people and a lot of locals and regulars, but I felt right at home. Plus it is close to the convention center and not too far from the strip.

Once a month, I treat myself with 2 bagelmania garlic bagels and a half pound of cornbeef. I can't think of a better meal. 

Keep note: if you eat here once, you will get uncontrollable craving for their food. Nothing will satisfy but the real thing.

I've been told the staff is grumpy, but they've always been very nice to me.

I've been wanting bagels when we took a recent trip to vegas.  We were at the UNLV campus so I checked on yelp to find the closest bagel shop with the best reviews... Harrie's Bagelmania popped up. It was very easy to find.  The shop shares the parking lot with other stores surrounding the area.  We went right when they opened.  The staff were so nice and friendly. It was our first time there and they were super helpful. 

I ordered the breakfast bagel sandwich which had a breakfast sausage, eggs, and cheese, and a choice of bagel. I also got a lox bagel.  Both were very delicious... I did opt for the everything bagel but the onions were a bit burnt on it.

Bf's family supposedly always comes here when they're in Vegas, so we got breakfast here before we left last weekend. I wasn't in the mood for bagels, so I ordered the eggs benedict -- that's my mistake right there. Who goes to a place with "bagel" in the name and orders something other than a bagel? The hollandaise sauce was just tooooo much. Too thick, but not really creamy. The potatoes that came with were also a little dry and overcooked.

Not a terrible place in the least, but I've just had better elsewhere.

When my boyfriend suggested bagels (and Einstein's) I immediately thought of this bagel place I've seen numerous times driving down Twain. It's one of the only businesses left in this shopping center but it was packed on the Saturday morning we visited. You can seat yourself if you're dining in or order at the counter for takeout. My boyfriend got the bagelwich with a side of potatoes and I got the Burton's 1-2-3-1. We got our food quickly. The portions were huge, especially the side of potatoes. I was a bit confused by dish. The menu said it came with either a plain or onion bialy, but the waitress asked what kind of bagel I wanted so I got an everything bagel. She also asked if I wanted to sub the Swiss for cream cheese (yes sure). The real sadness was that I only got two slices of lox when the "3" in the name is supposed to be 3 slices of lox. I wouldn't care but when I know my dish is almost 3x that of my boyfriends because of the lox alone it was a little disappointing. Also, the "thin" onion slice was not that thin. Overall the meal was enjoyable though. Next time I'll probably opt for some of their cheaper options. It feels like a friendly neighborhood deli and most of the patrons looked like regulars. Definitely giving this another try next time I'm in the mood for a bagel.

I had the 1 bagel & the salted lox plus cream cheese, tomato, cucumbers & 4 olives. Cost $19.00 for this. A little expensive but it was delicious & worth it. I'm from California & this plate is more there.

We've been coming here for 13 years and I didn't realize we had not been here since Dec.  Went to pick up some brisket for the holiday last week and found out under new ownership.
Was told food was the same.  It was Not!
Unfortunately for us I didn't open the brisket until the next night to eat only to find it about 75% fat and looked/ smelled old.  Threw it out.  If they were open at the time I opened it I would have brought/ given it back!

It was always consistent whenever we bought before.  Got a couple of other things and not very good.
Will NEVER go back.

For bagels, never loved theirs.  Bagel Cafe other side of town the best  very good. Even prefer Smiths bagels to theirs.

Great choice for a quick breakfast before heading to the Hover Dam. Pleasantly surprised to be greeted by Harrie herself. What a nice lady! Their bagels and tuna salad get an A+ (and I have had my fair share!) Reminded me of the hometown Jewish deli I grew up with. Done right!!
Food was good but service today was horrible. Only 1 cook, 1 server and one busboy. Waited 45 minutes for food.
Matzo brie was off the hook.  The portions are huge.  It is very reasonable.  A great place for breakfast.

Stopped by for takeout a few weeks ago.....two ham and cheese bagel sandwiches, macaroni salad and chicken soup. Took 30 minutes to get food and over $40.00!. Everything was stale and old tasting; the bagels, the meat, the macaroni salad and soup were all "off".  The chicken soup was clearly just thrown together while I waited. While driving home I could clearly smell the food didn't smell right. EVERYTHING was thrown in the garbage. When I went to write this review just a few days after my visit I saw on Yelp that this place closed down so I didn't write a review but now see its open again?!?   I'll never return.

Ordered food through uber eats. Received very burnt bagels and asked for a bagel not toasted with cream cheese on the side but received a bagel toasted with cream cheese on it. Gave them a second chance, very disappointed

I always come here when I want to celebrate my inner Jew that my ancestry test claims I have. 

We used to come here as a family when I was younger. My grandfather was the original Yelp and knew of all of the amazing spots no matter how far or sketchy they were. The decor has an 80s/90 and should probably be updated, but I'd like to think that's what makes this place so special. 

Their bagels and everything else as already mentioned are a bit pricy. I compare them to the bagels from your bagel chain and it really doesn't bother me. I haven't had breakfast here in long time. I'm usually just here for an everything bagel with schemer right before class at UNLV. Happy to have this spot with so many great memories so close to home!

Mmm! Loved my everything bagel with jalapeño creme cheese 
Delicious and fresh  
I loved the home-y vibe of this place 
They pack on the cheese so be prepared for a delicious mess

Harrie's is less than a mile from my condo, but that's not why I come here at least one Sunday Morning per month: It's everything!  From service to food it's consistently (for decades) perfect.
It's bagels, cream cheese & lox for me!
Ok. It's in the hood. So what. We're talking Jewish soul food. Potato pancakes are the bomb. Matzoh Ball soup is better than what Grandma made. Lox & onion omelette. Mmm.
So if you're in the mood for kosher style deli this is the place.

Bagels are pretty good.   Have gotten some sandwiches and traditional Jewish dishes- potato pancakes blintzes and knish.   Everything is pretty good.  Wouldn't say great.  They are heavy handed on the onions.   Coffee is pretty bad.    It's getting 4 stars because the inside is pretty yuck like the area.  Time for a remodel.  I'd be scared to use the bathroom inside.  At least now they take credit cards.
A friend who lives here in Vegas took me to this hidden gem.  My pastrami rueben was fantastic.  I'll definitely be back.

Delicious super platter (lox, sable, and whitefish, plain and scallion cream cheese, plus 3 bagels.) I even got a fourth, salt, which was quite nice with the right amount of salt and poppy seeds. Too much for the three of us to eat but we stumbled away happy and stuffed to the gills.

Really authentic bagels and great tasting cream cheese. I had a garlic bagel and it was savory. The potato knish was a bit different with potato chunks instead of completely mashed.  Nonetheless it still was delicious. I chatted with the friendly owner - he's a very nice guy.  Highly recommended near the Convention Center.

This place is not near me but went when nearby. Fantastic bagels! Brought back to office and had rave reviews. Hard to get decent east coast bagels here and this place hit it. Also had a meat knish which was ok but a bit bland.
