I'll be back...

when visiting vegas we always try to dine off strip and for breakfast, it was no exception. we came here on our way to the convention center and sat down for a hearty meal. yes, its a bagel shop which you can walk in, order and leave. but its a restaurant as well and you can sit and have a relaxing meal. you can tell its a local's place because most of the diners there look like they belong lol

i got the build your own omelet with spinach (no cheese), which comes with choice of fruit, cottage cheese or tomato slices ( i chose cottage cheese), and also comes your choice of bagel (i had the whole wheat) all for $8.99.  the portion was pretty generous and i actually couldnt finish it all and had to take the rest with me. 

my beau had the salmon scrambler which i was able to taste as well and it was very good. that probably would have been my second choice.

overall, the food is good, the service was quick and the price is just right! btw, the new york neighborhood mural on the wall is pretty freakin awesome!

really NYCish place in Las Vegas. I'll definetely come back! Unfortunately they close at 2pm
(sign says at least), though opening at 6.30a.m.
Excellent service and great bagels! Close to strip and safe location. Lots of parking directly out front. Lots of seating. Clean and welcoming.

I love this place!!

The food is fresh, made to order and REAL.

The bagel/Biale and lox spread is to die for!! No need for the full lox, the spread is LOADED with lox.

Stupid Yelp has me visiting a couple times, but I have been at least 6 times. 

It's cash only, but they have an ATM on premises. 

I do conferences and tradeshows- so I come thru Vegas reguarly and this IS my breakfast stop. It's close, fast, fresh and delicious!! 

Look for the locals- you will see them over and over. The staff is also the same day in, day out.

And I am ROLLING, laughing at the pregnant woman's dissertation on how bad this place is...she could have stopped with "I'm pregnant".

Stopped in for breakfast before the long, boring drive back to LA.

Easily the best lox I've had since I can't even remember when. Onion bagel and chive cream cheese were excellent. 

If I lived in town, Is definitely come here for meats and baked goods.

Awesome breakfast. Pancakes were super fluffy and grits were real grits, not instantly. My husband got steak and eggs and the steak was decent for a breakfast place and eggs were cooked over medium as asked. We got this delivered by Uber Eats and everything was piping hot when it arrived. Good breakfast!

Great stop for breakfast! I had an Everything bagel with lox and cream cheese. It was delicious and had huge chunks of fresh salmon in the spread. Yummy! My husband had the $7.99 special of eggs, ham, potatoes and a Jalapeño bagel. He loved his too! We will be back!

So glad we made an Uber trip away from the Strip where we were staying. Do yourself a favor and come here for breakfast. Had the hash and an Egg bagel with american cheese, fried egg, sausage and bacon. So delicious! Was a little apprehensive with any bagel place that claims to have great bagels. This place lived up. After living in Long Island and Jersey, I can recommend the bagels here. Get in an Uber and come here for breakfast. Huge portions too!

Seems pretty much like any bagel shop/deli that I've patronized in the northeast- family owned and operated and tons of regular customers of the senior-citizen class. I was about to drop $14 on the Nova platter when the waitress told me about a cheaper option that was exactly what I wanted. Bagels were huge and very tasty and I would come back for breakfast next time I'm nearby. Decor is outdated and so is this part of Vegas, but supporting a local business never goes out of style.

Ok, so I haven't been back to this place in almost a year. I use to rave about the Kreplach soup, but I was increasingly getting frozen kreplach that weren't completely thawed, or kreplach with freezer burn.  So I went cold turkey and stayed away.  I went back today, had a bowl of Kreplach Soup with 2 extra kreplach (glutton for punishment).  Much to my surprise, it was like I remember, before those freezer nightmares.  Am attaching a pik.

Good stuff.  Hope it wasn't luck!

Fantastic salami and onion omelette with cinnamon raisin bagels.  It's a a couple of years since I have been to Bagelmania. The neighborhood which was never great seems worse, but Bagelmania is definitely worth it!!!
Way overpriced. Ironically, in a bad neighborhood. The price range is incorrect, it's NOT "Under $10". Under $10 you can get some tiny side but that's it.

I have been wanting to try this place for sometime now and finally did it. I have been looking for real Deli's in Las Vegas and other than the Bagel Café and Carnage's at the Mirage hadn't found any. I had the best Pastrami Sandwich I have ever had today. The negatives, they charge $2 for a slice of cheese and the sandwich is pretty small. I usually try the Matzo Ball Soup too but this time I ordered Mish Mash (Matzo Ball Noodles and Kreplach  )  to go and will have it for dinner. On Tuesdays they sell Bagels $6.50 a dozen which I was told they make their own and Corned Beef and Pastrami at $12.50 a pound. I need to come by on a Tuesday and stock up. It's on the east side of town so they close at 3PM. Take the time and GO

I am a regular and I have been a regular for at least 20 years (So, who's counting!)  This place is the mecca for a traditional nosh in Las Vegas.  The city's biggest movers and shakers have called this place home.  Burton Cohen was here every day for decades and I even found Siegfried having breakfast in the place.  Some things never change, such as, the grill is the size of a postage stamp.  I have felt sorry for the guys who have to work that grill and get the food out when the place is packed on the weekend.  So, don't be surprised that your eggs and potato pancakes might be a bit on the well done side because they've got that grill turned up too high.  The homemade soups are very good, as are the specials, cookies, fish etc.  However, the bagels and bialys are sublime!  I've eaten N.Y. bagels and I have bought bialys from Kossar's.  The Bagelmania bagels are just as good as the best N.Y. bagels, and Harrie's bialys are BETTER THAN KOSSAR'S!  There is no comparison.  So, if you want the best bagels in Las Vegas and the best bialys in the U.S., go to Harrie's.  The only reason I am giving them four not five stars is due to the grill being so darn small.  I loved Mort and when he died, his wife Nancy, who was never in the business, took over and I say, "Thank the Lord," or I might have died from a case of severe bialy withdrawals.
Bagel choices were plentiful. Nice texture and flavor. Very generous with the eggs. I believe our waitress just started this week. Very friendly. Coffee was only downside. Need flavor creams??

We have been eating at Harrie's for years.  It is our Sunday morning go to place especially when company is in town.  The hoppel poppel is delicious, loaded with salami and the portions are definitely big enough to share.  The bagels are tasty, sometimes just a little doughy. The sandwiches are big and very tasty, especially the Rueben which is my favorite.  In addition to being a restaurant they have a deli and pastry counter for take out by the pound.  Everything is always fresh but perhaps a little pricey.  It is for sure a locals place as  you can tell from the clientele enjoying their food and the company of each other.  The staff, for the most part is friendly and accommodating.  My only disappointment is that they are only open until 3:00 p.m.

One of the best places to have breakfast in Vegas! This delicacy has been here for many years, and you can bet that if you find yourself here for lunch or for breakfast, you will eat well at a reasonable price. Quality has never wavered.

I came in and got two bagels on my lunch hour. They were nice and efficient and the bagels were nice and chewy. It is a good Jewish deli and I saw many "old school" Vegas types enjoying their breakfast. It is a true hole in the wall, so don't expect linen table clothes but the bagels and cream cheese were good and I saw lots of tempting things in the deli case which will make me come back. The area it is in is a bit sketch so just take note of that:)
Really nice, warm staff. The best bagels we've ever had. Huge breakfast portion sizes. Would definitely recommend it. If I didn't have limited check in space would have brought a dozen back home!

Unbelievable bagels here and even the hard-to-find bialy. Want to experience a bit of heaven? Order a toasted bialy with butter and a poppy bagel with the works. I got mine to go planning on heading back to the casino but took one bite in the car and sat there and ate everything in stunned silence. I wanted to head back in and give Harrie a big hug. Next time I'm in Vegas I'm heading straight to Harrie's. Also, the Nova was melt-in-your-mouth great and even rivaled Canter's Deli in LA for best lox anywhere.
Great variety of options. Homemade with lots of flavor. Friendly service. Family vibe.

Without question,  a little known secret in Vegas for a fabulous breakfast! The M-F breakfast special has gone up in price over the years, but at $7.99 it is still worth it! Three eggs with your choice of bacon or sausage, potatoes, and bagel of your choice! The eggs are real, the bacon is thick and salty, the potatoes are freshly diced and scrambled to a nice crispness, and the bagels are made in house and a variety of around 15! It's in a old strip building a few blocks from The Strip and really only known by the locals. Over the 10 years I've been faithfully visiting Harries, it's a sketchy neighborhood with a couple of bookies sitting in the back! There's always a cop presence in the joint and if the bookies aren't entertaining enough, you'll occasionally see a crack head walk by the front! It all adds to the ambiance of a old Vegas deli joint that's stood the test of time and still has the characters visit that kinda framed what Vegas used to be in a time gone by! This southern gentleman will continue to visit in hopes to continue to see a Vegas of time gone by!

Totally 5 stars all the way.  I'm only giving 4 stars because I love that it's a cool locals spot and a higher star rating would flood the place...  everything every time is phenomenal.  I highly recommend the pumpernickel bagel toasted with cream cheese.  Classic American diner, love it.

Great bagels.  Great sandwiches.  Real deli food.  Potato pancake was also awesome.  Have nothing bad to say about this place.  The fact that it's in a kind of run down "non-Vegas" part of Vegas is a plus for me.  Less than 5 minutes from the strip.  Reasonable prices.

Got 3 bagels with cream cheese and one bagel with ham and egg to go.  You can sit down here but we didn't have time do we got our good to go.  All the bagels were great and the cream cheese galvirs were good as well.  The  bagels had loads of cream cheese.  The ham in the egg sandwich was a thick slab of ham.  Great bagels.  Easy parking which helps too.

My first trip to Harrie's.  Enjoyed the food, and the service was good.  I had a tuna melt, and chicken soup.  It was all good, and the portions were huge.  Easy to get to location, with ample parking, at least when we went.  Would go again for food when in the neighborhood.

Bagelmania IS DEFINITELY one of the best real Jewish delicatessen deli's you will find in Vegas. It is just east of the strip in a semi questionable part of town, but anytime I go in its filled with older folks who eat brunch on Tuesdays while the rest of the town is hustling. Definitely takes me back East everytime I walk in. 
Amazing food guys -  seriously good food, great portions, moderately priced for the quality. I will gladly pay for quality food that was obviously made with love. 
Typical deli with bulk meats, they cook their own corned beef among other things. They have awesome hardy breakfast options as well as sandwiches and entres. They have a case full of salads and sides, the bagels are fresh daily (obviously) they even have the Italian cookies you pay by the pound (I believe), just like back east! 
Take an hour and stop by here for breakfast or lunch, or pick up some damn good fresh bagels for your office, you will not regret it. And I'll bet you will be back!

Can we just start off by saying how 
FRIENDLY the staff is? I ordered the eggs Benedict. Hollandaise made to order?? It was perfect. Eggs were poached perfectly. The ham was a little thick for my taste, but not worth taking "points" off for everything else. The Hubbster got the Rueben omelet. Delightful in all ways. The Bagel. OMG. Friggin perfect. When toasted it was crunchy on the outside and warm and chewy on the inside. Bagelmania is now my go to for bagels and lox. FANTASTICKA!!

Frightening location and disturbing patrons can be a real put off but this throwback old school deli has the good stuff. Superb soups, shockingly good bagels and real deal meats and fish make up for the freakshow both inside and outside.

Place was filthy. I read reviews and decided to give it a try. I wanted to eat some fresh bagels and to my disappointment and my husbands the place looked very unkept and just plain gross. My husband chose not to order anything since he got so grossed out with the dirtiness of the establishment. I would never go back again. Bagels wasn't the best I've had.

We were looking for a cheaper breakfast option on our vacation...  Bagelmania was the perfect spot.  Its a local place located in a strip mall a few blocks off the strip.  It was pretty busy with lots of local regulars.  The portions were generous and the food was great.  Try the homemade hash and a fresh baked bialy.  You won't regret it!

My favorite bagel shop in Las Vegas. Whenever we come to Vegas to play we stop at Harries to get my favorite salt bagel with vegetable cream cheese. My mouth is watering writing this review.  They have excellent breakfast too. I love the salami and eggs. The service is  good and the servers are always friendly. The prices are very reasonable. It's really close to the Strip but the area is a tad shady but we have never had a problem.
Delicious bagels. Super friendly and fast service. The area is a little strange but I live nearby so I knew what to expect.

This is a great place to just grab a quick bite ! Great service, been here couple times and never a let down. Location is the only sketchy part but it is still worth it !!! Love their chicken soup , matzo ball soup , bagel and their breakfast sandwiches. The black and white cookie is great also!

If you want to feel llike you're sitting in a diner in somewhere in the Village eating bagels - this is the place! It's nothing fancy and you probably won't find any tourists in here (or gamblers for that matter). But the bagels are the best ones I had outside of New York City. And their Lox Cream Cheese spread is awesome! I would come back here just for that...!
As you drive by you don't imagine a great little breakfast place is inside. The staff is fast and very polite.  The food is great and a breakfast sandwich on a bagel is just about $5.

I eat at Bagel mania 6 days a week.
Great bagels,great soups,great specials..
 Just a great local place....

Came here on Christmas to grab some breakfast. I have to say its not in the greatest part of town but that didn't deter us. We needed bagels and bagels is what we had. So far this has been the closest to an east coast bagel I have personally had here in town. Cream cheese was great too. Service was friendly and quick and we will be back soon.

Are you shitting me?
This charming place is in the sketchiest part of Vega$$ and yet it's the cutest little place ever.
Frequented by retired people who have a whole 'nother appreciation of the beauty of a relaxing breakfast, I found myself charmed by the environment, the service and the food. 
It serves all day, and it's one of places that tourists would never find or make a destination, so I feel a bit of Las Vegan ownership already. 
I'll go back again and if you want some company, hit me up, I'm sure I'll be game.
Fun dive! Felt like we were in NYC. Would definitely return! The lady that runs the place is a little quirky... but, only interacted with her when we paid the bill.

Holy Moly! I ordered through Uber Eats and I'm so glad I did! I got a dozen bagels with the two cream cheese. The apple cinnamon spread is sooo good. I will be getting bagels for the office from Harrie's from now on.

Fantastic Jewish deli. Bagels are wonderful and the lox was piled high. All the traditional flavors including pumpernickel and egg. Bialys too. Ended up taking a dozen for the road after eating here be cause we knew we'd want more for the next morning.

Harrie's Bagelmania-This place has HISTORY-It's a part of the fabric of Las Vegas an old school NY-style Jewish Deli.

In a small shopping center at Swenson & Twain its just between the STRIP and the Boulevard Mall. Also in the same center is the HAIFA Restaurant another Jewish eatery.

It's known for its Friendly service and REAL food. FRESH made bagels and More. It's a little cramped in there with NO boothes and most patrons are regular who are WELL-FED! lol

They know your name and what you are gonna order before you get seated. Along the back wall is a mural of an old school neighborhood with people looking out their 3rd story window of their brownstone hollering the ice cream man-etc(you get the picture)

Well they have polaroid cut-out of REAL customer taped over the faces on the mural to personalize it-VERY COOL!!

As far as the food goes-I guess you have to be Jewish or from NY to appreciate it. Eggs & Onions,Lox with Onions, and Matza just not my cup of tea Being an Iowa Farm boy.

I haven't walked out of a lot of restaurants without ordering but we did here today. We've been here before and had a good experience but today was ridiculous. Asked for a highchair for our son, didn't get it, got it ourselves. Ordered coffee, did not get it, waitress came back to take our food order and had no clue that she had never gotten the drinks. Asked for a milk for my son, and then she wandered off and came back with just the milk, no coffee. We asked again for the coffee and she wandered off again and brought back the wrong drinks. It was like the waitress had no idea where she was or what was happening. The only other time I have seen someone so out of it was when they were high. We left because we were clearly never going to get any food. Completely ridiculous.

Made a stop in Vegas for work and wanted a mom n' pops location for breakfast.
Just what we were looking for!
Great service. Great food. Large parking lot.
We ordered the bagel and lox and they let you taste the salted and non salted lox. The non salted lox already is salted so if you want to be healthy, you won't be cutting back on the taste by selecting "non-salted."
The bagel is claimed to resemble NY style. Though I still think NY bagels are the best, this wasn't off by too far. 
We also got the fresh squeezed OJ and it was perfect! I love pulp and they had a good about of pulp in each sip!
I would definitely come back again next time I'm in town! Thank you, Harrie Jr.!

Real deal bagels. Also great selection of authentic New York style deli offerings. Always friendly, a bit pricey, but worth it for food you can not find it very many places this side of the Mississippi.

Overall the best place for bagels and lox or rate pastrami sandwich.

Harrie continues to deliver. We brought some friends here who had salivated upon hearing of our past experiences, and they seemed to think it lived up to every last drop of the hype.  Menu highlights the smoked whitefish and sable platters lived up to their reputation.  Prices seem to be increasing with the minimum wage and/or the scarcity of smokeable fish, but still a good value.
Not bad.  Bagels were amazing and the only reason to really go.   The soup was okay but not that great.   The matzah balls were a bit hard.   Definitely a good bagel place.

Reminds me of a NJ bagel shop more than any other place I have found in Vegas. A bacon, egg and cheese on a well-made bagel (with real eggs and crispy bacon) seems to be a rarity on the West coast but they have them here for $4.50. I have found breakfast sandwiches like that elsewhere, on crappy bagels, for upwards of $7 (really!) Also tried the corned beef (lean) on rye (too many caraway seeds) which was good and the matzoh ball soup which was also good but could have used some actual chicken. I'll be back for sure, though. Also, they have special discounts on bagels, corned beef and pastrami on Tuesdays. Bring cash, no credit cards accepted.

Harrie's Bagelmania is an excellent deli. I had a nice bagel, a nice bialy, and a good pastrami omelet.
I mentioned on another discussion board that I thought Weiss' Deli in Henderson had the best bagel Ilve had outside New York and I had a couple of people say they thought Harrie's was better. I've eaten at both places only once, but I think I like Weiss' bagels better.
Harrie's is still a great place. Everything tastes freshly made. Service was excellent at Harrie's too. 
The everything bagel I got was crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside, just like it should be. I also appreciate that they make their own pastrami.
It's cash only.

On very visit to Las Vegas we stop at Harrie's Bagelmania. The deli takes you back to the old
time delicatessen with true deli food. The menu is filled with true Jewish food items. This is a local restaurant to get you away from the strip if you are a visitor. You will not go wrong.

Finally got to try this bagel place when I was back in Vegas doing maintenance. The bagels are the real deal, 4.5 star but not the best in town. Bagel cafe off of Buffalo is better for sure. So if you live on the westside or Summerlin you really don't need to bother coming to Harrie's besides to just check it out. The bagels have high gluten and a thick chewy crust, just like they are supposed to. Too crunchy though. If you leave them out for any bit of time in the desert air they become very hard very quickly. This place is an old school deli. It reminds me of a bagel deli I used to go in Fort Lauderdale when I lived in Florida.

Now a few weeks ago, my request to find kreplach soup that I sent to the RJ's Taste of the Town in February, suddenly showed up in the newspaper!  Now, I never read newspaper tangiibly or online, but I happened to check it and see my request, 8 months later.  The truth is, as everyone can see here, I found kreplach soup in town back in May.  I had not been back to Harrie's since my first trip because whenever I think to go there, it is after their 3 PM closing time.

However, this weekend I felt miserable, and decided the only way to recuperate was to get kreplach soup.  Eric R. and I happened to have planned on lox and bagels for breakfast, so I decided to get a half dozen bagels there too.  I walked in, grabbed a bottled Dr. Brown's black cherry, and at the counter I declared with passion, "Give me the largest container of kreplach soup you have!"  The lady smiled and pointed to a big to go container, and I waved my hand and exclaimed, "PERFECT!"

Then I proceeded to order a half dozen bagels for Eric R. and a small cream cheese (he had the Tofutti one in the fridge but I think he really wanted the real deal so I surprised him).  In the end, I came home and had a giant bowl of kreplach soup accompanied by bagel chips, then some lox (aka brain food), whipped out some capers and sliced onion for Eric R., and saved the other half of the soup to get me through today.  A combination of Harrie's kreplach soup, Eric R.'s furnishing me with love and kleenex, and benadryl have nursed me back toward normalcy.

Stopped for breakfast yesterday morning based on the reviews. We were surprised that it was not busier. Our breakfast was OK. The service was a little sloppy. It took a while to get our drinks. My big complaint was that they did not have a restroom for customers. The waitress did sneak me back but it was hush hush. I thought it was a regulation that all full service food establishments must provide restrooms. I read the recent reviews this morning and saw that there are new owners. My suggestion to them is to make your place more customer friendly. You will not have a business without customers.

What wonderful bagels they make! Lunch was excellent also. I ordered a cup of lentil soup and a side of sour cream. Add the bagel crisps that came with it, and I had a satisfying lunch not involving meat. My companion had the half pastrami sandwich/cup of cabbage soup combo and ate every bite. The place doesn't accept credit cards but has an ATM in the corner for those without the green.

This place is terrible and deserves no stars except the server was very nice a younger lady.The matzo ball soup was tasteless and the carrots were hard.The Kasha Knish was hard and had no taste and was dry.The potato pancake was hard and burnt.The pastrami sandwich was small and poor quality mear.Everything was overpriced.On the way out i opened the door and the owner yelled at us and said you are letting out all the air conditioning.There were no other customers in this place besides us because it sucks.And to top it all off outside there were crackheads and bums begging for money.this restaurant is in the ghetto and you take your life in your hands going in there

I wanted to love Harrie's Bagelmania. I didn't! There is a scarcity of New York style bagel shops in Las Vegas. The only three that I know of are Bagel Cafe (Summerlin), NY Bagels (downtown), and Harrie's Bagelmania. 

 Harrie's Bagelmania is in an economically challenged neighborhood. I was surprised to see the exorbitant prices that are disproportionate to the average income of the area and the highest prices that I have seen a bagel restaurant charge. Nearly $15 for a bagel with lox Sandwich!? Your kidding Me! Nearly $9 for a bagel with egg salad! This is before paying for a beverage. 

  I opted for the bagelwich with a fried egg and ham. This is one of the reasonable priced items on their menu. Interestingly the only style of egg listed was fried. What about scrambled?  I wasn't too crazy about the bagelwich. When I taste a bagel, my expectation is that it is hot and soft. This bagelwich fell short of my expectation. The ham was okay. As far as the coffee it was also okay. 

  I was satisfied with the service. The waitress was on top of my coffee refills at the same that she was pleasant. When I paid the cashier joked over the  change being an unlucky number. I easily rectified that when I left the waitress a tip for good service. 

  I don't love Harrie's Bagelmania. To be honest I left disappointed with the exorbitant pricing and bagelwich that fell short of my expectations yet satisfied with the service. My Harrie's Bagelmania check-ins stop here.
Omg.. bomb.com..will stop by here everytime I come to Vegas, here on out.

Sometimes you get a craving for something...for me it was lox and bagels on an everything bagel with capers. And nothing else will do. Yeah, I could have went to Einstein Bagels...and had some teenager slap something together for me. I didn't want that, I wanted a good bagel place, locally owned, and that knows how to make great bagels. I found what I was looking for at Harrie's Bagelmania. 

Yes, it's in a "sketchy" part of town for some people. So what. Walk in, have a seat, and let them bring you a menu. Service was spot on...I had questions, I got answers without attitude. My food arrived fast. My check didn't arrive until I was just about finished. I like service like that which I consider just right. 

But all that means nothing, what about the food? I had another one of those OMG did I order more than I can eat moments? That bagel was stacked! And it was kinda messy too (which is good and that's NOT a complaint!). And while I thought $1 extra for the capers was a bit pricey....they loaded my bagel up!

Decor wise the place could use a slight facelift, but to be honest I was too busy chowing down to give a dang about decor. They are a bit pricey for my typical lunch and way over the top on calorie counts but if you gotta have lox and bagels, Harrie's Bagelmania has what you need. I will be back! 

(Bookmarked for months....boy am I glad I finally got over there to check it out. Oh and they take credit / debit cards...no ancient ATM in sight as mentioned by earlier reviewers, but I brought cash just in case.)

(Yelp 100 in 2013 Challenge #2)

Looking for actual Vegas locals? This is the place. Oldschool. Fresh. Bagels. If you are looking for fancy-schmancy or corporate-cookie cutter, you are in the wrong place. But if you like off the beaten path, mom & pop, every-day Jewish Deli slash diner food, you're in for a treat! The waitress might have been a little Ed Debevic's without the irony but so what. Expect it. After breakfast, we took a dozen bagels to go! BTW, CASH ONLY!
By the way... If you are looking for schmalz it is available for purchase by the pound.
Not all bagels are created equal. This is the closest we have found to a proper Eastcoast Bagel - our go to lunch is to share the bagel with lox and have it open faced so we each get a proper half.
Best Jewish deli food around! I will drive from anywhere to get my hands on this matzo ball soup and bagel chips. I had their roast beef sandwich too and I can't wait to go back and try the rest!
This is a great spot in Vegas for a quick meal.  Lunch is great and breakfast is even better.  Love the salt bagel!  If your in Vegas get off the strip and make a stop over to Bagelmania.

Love this place!  Came here to get some breakfast to go.  We took out some bagels and a knish.  Bagels were good and fresh and the knish was good and authentic.  Good prices on those.  Also took out a couple of OJ's and milk to wash it all down.  The drinks were a bit pricey and ended up being more than a third of the whole breakfast.  Next time, we'll head to the grocery store for drinks.  

The place was clean and the staff very helpful.  Would have liked to eat in but not this trip.  Definitely recommend.

As a Jewish girl who lives in a predominantly Mormon state, I was thrilled to find Bagelmania.  The best corned beef hash I've ever had and the bagels, amazing.  Great black and white cookies and we picked up some pastrami for the road.  The cole slaw a little too creamy for my taste, but everything else terrific

Great lunch place ...I had the cup of Matzo Ball soup it was delicious..very hot with lots of celery and carrots....my friend and I shared the corned beef sandwich which also was very good...prices are reasonable. If you come at 1 o clock you beat the lunch crowd.

This place looks really decent. I got two lox bagels today. And I have no idea how or why? But the bagel was the saltiest thing I've ever tasted. It tasted like someone has poured salt in the bagel on purpose. It was absolutely horrible. Not to mention  we spent $15 for a lox bagel. $30 wasted. Don't get it. Worst part is that we are headed back to Los Angeles and we're unable to return this sad excuse of a bagel. So annoyed

ok so this is a pretty sketchy part of town,but it doesn't bother me or worry me. In the course of doing business in los angeles I was always in industrial or areas where business's had their warehouses in run down areas. I was pleasantly surprised with this eatery. Its a bit of a drive for me but runs about 1/2 the cost of bagel cafe. I had their 7.99 breakfast special. Onions and eggs sausage patty's (2) potatoes and a bagel. This is good old fashioned large portions and good food. quite a spread from the ripoff that is the strip,and basically a stones throw from there. Its near the convention center so for all you visitors its an awesome fillup on your way to long full day of work. For value they get two thumbs up! the service was also right on point. I will say it would be nice if they improved their coffee, a bit weak for my starbucks palate. otherwise a solid good value.

Had breakfast at Harrie's on a Saturday.  It was before 9 AM, and there was only one other table seated when I walked in.  After I ordered, people kept trickling in until the place was nearly half full.  It's in a not so great part of town, and it only takes cash, but these are not reasons to skip Harrie's.  They have a large menu with all of your east coast deli favorites, made on the premises.

I had the Hoppel Poppel, which, and there is no other way to put this, is an enormous amount of food.  It's home fries with eggs, peppers, onions and salami into a glorious scramble that easily covers the whole plate and could probably cover another one.  It comes with your choice of bagel.  I got an everything bagel toasted, and it comes with a lot of cream cheese.  I didn't finish either my scramble or the cream cheese.  The Hoppel Poppel is good, but when you put some Cholula on it, it becomes great.  The potatoes I don't think were seasoned, but the peppers and salami add a lot.  Also, the salami is fantastic, not greasy at all.  I guess if I have a criticism of this dish, it's the lack of seasoning.  But, adding hot sauce really worked.

I got the wife corned beef with eggs to go.  Her potatoes were not seasoned, but they were cooked well.  Not surprisingly, the order of eggs with corned beef was massive.  Yet another breakfast we couldn't finish.  

Service was fantastic, the check was brought out quickly as was my to go order.  Friendly people and a comfortable atmosphere.  Can't wait to return to get a huge sandwich for lunch.
This place is great. Bagels are yummy. The soup is great. The location is not good at all but still a great spot.

Although locals may understandably grouse about paying close to $15 for a nova bagel, we Angelenos have been paying such tribute at the Langer's Deli altar for decades.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/langers-los-angeles-2#query:langers%20deli


The comparison is apt, because Langer's is also in a part of town not hitherto known for its culinary excellence.  Also apt, because both places have the same sort of quaint Aunt Enid-like "sit down and eat, Bubbeleh, you look skin and bones" type of feel.

But where Langer's has lines down the block and has been designated a cultural heritage site, this place is still somewhat fledgling, although I did see a Bentley and a Maybach during my 20 minute stay on a weekday morning, so surely they aren't far from stardom.

The bagels here are legit, yo, and the nova salmon sublime.  So too, the Russian Tea cake cookies, which are melt-in-the mouth delicious.

Second time going to this place the first time they were really slow, the second time I ordered my order 20minutes ago I just got there it was supposed to be ready in 10 minutes (prior to my arrival)and they hadn't even started making my order yet I am so unpleased with this place they are rude and don't seem to like their jobs pretty much. Never again!!!
The bagel was good. Lots of bagel options to choose from. It's hard to find a place open at 7am in Vegas. Wished staff was more friendly.

This place filled the desire for an authentic Jewish/New York deli. Meyer Lansky would have been proud . The lox was fresh and amazing and the chive cream cheese was for me new and delicious . The bagels fresh and flavorful . The potato pancakes were cooked just right and the Ruben exquisite .

I am having a tough time rating places, because when I am reading reviews I am looking for a place in the 4 to 5 stars range. However, when  I review I feel like 5 stars is the best EVER. I am changing, my 5 stars is now...I can not wait to go back! Harrie's is a perfect example.  The food was great, the service wonderful, the place was clean. The egg and sausage bagelwich is superb. My wife had the lox sandwich and while it was expensive, it took both of to finish it. We are already planning our next trip. Another, place that I am glad that it is not in my neighborhood, or I would eat there too much!

If I'm on my way to, or from the sports book at LVH (yes I will still call it that lol) or heading to Chinatown from Henderson I pass this place often. I've had it bookmarked a while and decided to finally give this place a try. When I'm in the area I usually keep driving because you never know what you'll get in this. Located in the ever so famous crack alley this place isn't a place you think you would enjoy or have high hopes for outside of yelp just looking in from the outside, but enough about the lovely area this place is actually quite good if you look past the exterior. When a waffle place close by had no seats I looked into my bookmarks and saw harries was close so we stopped by on a Sunday around noon. 


First impression the place is a bit dated and could use a makeover. The carpet was a bit grungy and the tables looked like the came from the 70's. I decided I was going to stay and let the food do the talking. I already knew I wanted lox and a bagel. Nova is the less salty version and there's a few options to choose from. I went with the burton 1-2-3, almost like the platter but with less nova. My handsome decided on the three fer. Which has a knish (your choice of meat or potato) a potato pancake, and a cheese blintz. The nova was fresh, not too salty. I had it on an onion bagel with cream cheese. I added capers as my plate didn't come with them. I thoroughly enjoyed my nova and bagel with schmear. The three fer plate was enough for just the two of us to share but we both shared both our plates. The knish was loaded with brisket and the postal pancake was crispy and savory. Our server was friendly and our food came out in good time. I also took home some rugelach. Yes I just googled the spelling. Little pastries with Apple and raspberry filling. They also have chocolate but chocolate is not my thing. I would come back here and try some more jewish staples. The challah French toast looks nommy as well as the kreplach. Unil next time Harries. Shalom!
Dirty silverware and dishes.  Bagel was good, not enough cream cheese.  Table was sticky and not clean.
Wanted something off the strip. Bagels were great and the price was great as well! Former New Yorker recommended. You will be very happy easy to get to and plenty of parking.
Their Bagels are the best in Las Vegas. REal water bagels. Food is also very good.
We come here for breakfast every time we're in Vegas. Really cute family-owned restaurant. The food is always good. I like that it's a bit outdated, it reminds me of the 90's.

Old school Jewish Deli with great food. 
No frills dining, but they're the real deal!
The bagels are awesome, as well as the scallion cream cheese and lox. 
The service was excellent.

Sadly, I never had an Elvis sighting here in my many jaunts to Vegas and breakfasts at this place. Great homemade bagels- I am partial to the everything bagel, which is dense and soft and fresh and crunchy on the outside. Coffee is okay and hash and eggs are standard...but you're really just here for the bagels (and the Elvis sighting) so it's all good. A great place for cheap weekend brunch.

It is what it is. It is not fancy. They don't serve health food. It is a classic. The service can be quite terrible, and they don't accept credit cards. Cash only! However, they have an ATM machine from the 80s. It is the weirdest thing. It doesn't give you cash. It gives you a receipt, and then you give the receipt to the server who brings you your money. 

The bagels are a little small but wonderfully and perfectly chewy. On this past visit, I went with a bagelwhich on an everything bagel. I decided not to get it toasted because everything bagels sometimes turn bitter if they're over toasted. It was a strong call, as the bagel was perfect untoasted. I actually went with ham, and the ham was a nice, thick country ham like I grew up on in Georgia. (Well, maybe it had a little less salt.) For $3.95 (which my friend had to pay for because I was without cash!), it is a solid breakfast.

I haven't tried lunch here, but I would say the breakfast is pretty standard fare. You don't go to Harrie's for trendy morning bites. You go here for breakfast with some Vegas oldtimers. Don't forget your cash.

Om nom nom - stopped here on our way out of Vegas. Hubby and I are bagel aficionados, these were authentic, chewy, fresh, and a perfectly healthy amount of cream cheese. So worth the 10-minutes-out-of-our-way drive! Don't do Einstein, do Harrie's!

Real NY style bagels. Better than Noah's/Einsteins. Noah's was good before purchased by Einstein's, now they are just round loaves of Bread with no bagel consistency.
If you know bagels and love real bagels, Harry's BAGELMANIA is the place to go.  

Richard Gertler 
NYC 
This is where I get bagels when I visit Vegas.
My fiancé and I had a breakfast bagel (bacon,egg, and cheese) and it was even better than our favorite NYC bagel place!!!! We will definitely be back!

Great local bagel spot in Las Vegas. If you have access to a car and are looking to get some local jewish deli breakfast, I highly recommned Bagelmania.

Highlights:
- Bagels extremely cheap compared to one the Strip prices
- High quality bagels and sandwiches
- Friendly service
- Parking is in a strip mall
- Locals eat here

Overall, this is a great place to get a bagel and coffee to start the day at an affordable price.

Great bagels and billies. Lox, corned beef, pastrami, whitefish salad, matzo ball soup all are delicious. Nancy runs a solid deli you can count on. Always great. Used to be top political spots in town.

All I could think about from the moment I woke up was, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?". While getting ready for the gym, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?". While at the gym, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?". After the gym, "Where can I get some lox and bagels?".

Well, hello Harrie's Bagelmania. I have had you bookmarked for well over six months. Thank you cravings that would put a pregnant woman to shame. When I want a certain food, let no one get in my way. 

The service is quick and efficient. As I walked through the door, the busperson already had ice water and menu in hand and was walking to my table. Two minutes later, the waitress took my order. 5-10 minutes and my Nova Lox and Everything Bagel was out. I had ordered the Fresh Fish Platter For One ($14.99). My unsalted salmon came with a scoop of either plain or chive cream cheese, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, and olives. The chive cream cheese uses fresh chopped greens. The everything bagel was chewy and possessed an amalgamation of all their savory components. On top of that, not only did I have enough of ingredients to dress two half bagels, but top the extra veggies with salmon. With each order, there was six strips of the fatty fish. I am thankful because recently I have become a garbage disposal. 

The restaurant was half packed and the staff was able to finish my meal in half an hour. It is a great place for a quick breakfast.

The bagels are excellent!!! Everyone there is very nice as well. My cup of coffee is never even close to being empty. The guy that runs around with water and coffee is on it!! And he is super polite! I was born in New York and grew up eating awesome bagels and these are the only ones like that in Vegas. I did order the eggs Benedict once and did not like it at all. But bagels are their specialty, so I understand. The hollandaise was grainy. Another time they made me an egg white omelet with spinach and mushrooms it was delicious! Plus it came with a bagel and I got fruit instead of home fries, so great options. Yesterday I tried their beef barley soup and it was pretty tasty came with bagel chips. Very reasonable prices as well!! I'm so happy I found this place!
Best chicken in a pot ever.The bagels are also fantastic. Service is wonderful.
Old school Vegas that has incredible bagels.  U can't go wrong here for taste or price.  Service is excellent too.  I love the place

I was told about this place from a man on a cruise ship last winter.  I FINALLY stopped in, even though it's just around the corner from work!  The bagel was great and the amount of Lox they put on is YUM!  I'm looking forward to going there again.

Place is very good! Many options for bagels,cream cheese, and omelette. One thing I loved about this place is: they had fresh any kind of cream cheese. Service was quick and food was hot. Price were also reasonable not to expensive.
Been having these since I can remember!! Very delicious bagels! Made from scratch! I suggest to try various because they're all delicious  local spot , indeed.

This Jewish deli is in a strip mall a few blocks drive from the Strip.  They have tasty breakfasts at a far more reasonable price than the Strip.  The bagels are great.  I wasn't a fan of their smoked whitefish salad, but it was definitely smoked and came in a huge portion.
Great New York style bagels. It reminds me of a Mom and Pop shop in any East Coast city. The prices are great and the service is amazing. The coffee outstanding!

In town last month for a trade show and our group was looking for good bagels. A yelp search brought us here. The bagels were amazing, as well as some of the bagel sandwich and other breakfast entrees our group ordered. We even went back the next day, though disappointed in the service, the waitress called off and the other one was new. After waiting 15 minutes we were informed it would be awhile still, we had to order breakfast to go, the staff tried their best to accommodate but we were only able to get bagels to go. Regardless will still go back when we return in August.

The bagel was good, cream cheese was ok. 
The prices are high and the money you are paying for is NOT going towards things like vacuuming the floor, cleaning the tables, the windows, the cases or the decor. God knows what is behind the scenes! I like dives, but this place was just plain dirty. Will get our bagels somewhere else.

Don't let the location fool you! Went with a good friend of mine who has been coming here for years. The Reuben omelette was calling my name and sure enough, best omelette I've had! Huge portions for the price. I will be back! Yum.

Jewels in the rough! It's in a run down plaza that I wouldn't think of stopping on Twain but first time I was there I ran into former Mayor Oscar Goodman to stop here for lunch! The bagel and cream cheese are delicious esp the lox cream cheese! I've been recommending people in my office (Hughes Center) to grab lunch there! And! They have pastrami as well! Not as good as Katz in NYC but it's probably as good as you can get in Vegas.

I have come to this place for many years and I always come back because the food and the service is wonderful but these last two times the service was very bad that really made me very sad because it was one of my favorite places:((
Had to walk out no service, place dirty lack help. New management no good . Never go back

Great little bagel shop with a diner feel.  The decor is old fashioned, some may even say run down, but I thought it was quaint and no-fuss.  I love that it is a local establishment that serves good quality food.  It wasn't crowded on a Friday morning, so my girlfriends and I immediately got a table and our orders taken.

I ordered an everything bagel with lox cream cheese (cream cheese with smoked salmon in it).  YUM.  We were visiting Vegas so we also ordered a dozen bagels to-go with a pound of cream cheese for about $12.  Not bad considering it was supposed to be breakfast for the four of us for 3 mornings.  I think that's about as cheap as you're gonna get for eating in Vegas on vacation!

Based on service only as we were seated at a crammed filthy table with the place being less than half full. Noone took our order or even gave us a menu or high chair for our baby as we asked for, for about 20 min. Two tables that came in after us already  had thier food. So we walked out. Being from Brooklyn we miss bagels and if  we were served I'm sure we would have been regulars. They may be trying to be as stereotypical New Yorkers but it wasn't working.
Love the jalapeño bagel here! And the lady serving us was so nice. My boyfriend got the scrambled eggs and hash. It was a looooot of food. I would come back for another bagel!

Only place for a long platter and the best corn beef on rye.. . This is an every Friday morning treat for us.  Great service great deli counter cooks. . What more to say,  oh,  yes,  the bagels. Tuesdays bagel special 5.50 dozen
Great place! Large (and delicious) bagels with great cream cheese. The cherry short bread cookies are amazing, as are the shortbread cookies covered in chocolate and sprinkles.

I'm in Vegas every few months and this is a spot I frequent.  They're super friendly and the food is great.  It's seems to be more of a local joint, and it has that mom and pop shop feel. I get the hopplepopple every time without question. It comes with a bagel and I've never left hungry. I heart this place.

A true delicatessen. Don't let the surroundings discourage your patronage. Bagels were insanely delicious and fresh. Wait staff is efficient. Woman behind counter gives it a New York flair. Will stop here on every trip I make back to Vegas.

This place is truly a hidden treasure. It's a small, family-owned authentic Jewish deli with an incredibly friendly staff and it is SOOOOO GOOD!!!! Harrie's Bagelmania is so much more than just a bagel shop. Absolutely everything is hand made from scratch and you can taste the love. Their sausage, egg, and cheese bagelwich blows all other breakfast sandwiches out of the water. The matzo ball soup tastes like your Jewish friend's grandma made it especially for you on a chilly day. The chicken salad is more flavorful than any I've ever tried; it was delicious (and I don't even like chicken salad, I only got to try this one because my friend ordered it). And the biali...OH the biali! For those of you unfamiliar with a biali (like I was), it is a type of bread -- similar to a bagel but not as dense-- with tiny minced onions and other delicious flavorings in the center. I've eaten their biali with the chicken salad, with the matzo ball soup, with cream cheese, and by itself...all amazing. I'd go to this place every single day if it weren't for the fact that doing so would turn me in to Shamu. I highly recommend it.

Note: They are cash only.
So yummy to find a bagel spot here in Vegas. Nothing fancy, just good bagels and great service by a local waitress. The basics are where it's at!

Possibly one of three best bagels and breakfast places ever... It may me a little hard to find but so worth it... The bagels leave New York bagels in the dust and everything from the sausage to the eggs is delicious. Great service and great people.... I would make the drive from LA every morning to eat here.  After having breakfast for en entire week in Vegas at all the top hotels I found a place that actually tastes good.

Yay! I'm MOST DEFINITELY a fan. 

Sadly, I have never heard of this place, nor been to this place. However, I did have these delicious bagels brought into my life when they were delivered to me at work. 

I got a dozen of my favorite: Everything Bagel! I have never had a better everything bagel!!! I am no expert or aficionado of bagels, but I was blown away. Aside from the taste and the abundance of garlic, onions, poppy seeds galor.... the texture was also perfect. The top half of the bagel was loaded and dense/fluffy... while the bottom was denser and had a nice bite to it. 

I can't wait to make a presence in this said to be authentic bagel shop so I can see what all they have to offer and re-write my review! 

Right now I am about to try the cinnamon bagel... and I'm excited:]

I'm not happy to even give this place one star.  The bagels are only eatable if they are toasted.  The owner hasn't updated the restaurant ever, much less since I've been going (25 years).  It's unkempt, borderline dirty.  You have to go through the kitchen for the bathroom.  Today is the last day I will go into bagelmania for any reason; $3.50 for A black & white cookie.  Crazy and very sad.
So great!! Such a hidden surprise. We both ordered bagels and the potatoes and it was awesome. Rosa was our server and she was such a delight. Highly recommend!

I got their generic breakfast that comes with potatoes, two eggs, and a bagel. I got the salt bagel and it came toasted but it was a little too toasted. The potatoes were the best part of my meal because they were real and seasoned perfect. The eggs were over easy but were a little too on the easy side.. I would say they know how to make bagels the right way here but I should have just gotten a bagel breakfast sandwich instead. Not sure if I will come back here again, wasn't anything I was super crazy about.
Delicious! Even the plain cream cheese is special!  Friendly service and the owner is fabulous to

My husband and I were just talking about how Las Vegas is becoming a close second to NYC for us.  Las Vegas has the shows, the food, etc.  The one important thing that Las Vegas was missing was the NYC bagel and pizza.  Well now they got the bagel.  Thank you Harrie and Nancy! 

I tried the jalapeno and cheese, sesame, everything, and poppyseed.  They were all very very good.  Just enough bite on the outside and chewiness on the inside.  What i was truly impressed with was that the lox spread had actual chunks of salmon in it.  Very, very yum.  I also had the vegetable and strawberry spread, and they were also very good.  Nancy mentioned that she adds no preservatives into her products.  I think that's all the more reason to give this place a try.  You won't regret it.

This was a great find! We had half a sandwich and soup option. It was probably the matzo ball soup I have ever had, the bagels were delightful and the pastrami was good - maybe a little to fatty,  but good nonetheless. I did order the potato pancake and they were a little different than what I'm used to but it was very good. The texture of the pancake was not shredded potato, but more like mashed. I would still order it again. It is a great place for breakfast or lunch if you're near the convention center.

Good for breakfast and brunch. It is located in a rough part of the city. I recently moved closer to downtown so I drop by often. 

Nova/lox sandwiches are my favorite. Be careful, Lox can get too salty (or was it the other way around??). You can get all your standard bagels. All of them freshly baked. Hash corned beef is very good. A side of them is big enough for 2. 

it is a good deli in that part of the city.  Not a world-class place  but good for Vegas and the best you can get in that area.
Bagelmania has been around for a long time. They have great food and their bagels are amazing. The only down side is that they don't take credit cards. ...It's a bummer it's cash only.

Underrated gem.  Great food, friendly people.  Best deli food I've had in Las Vegas - better than the bigger names on the strip.  Lox is fantastic.  Bagels fresh and New York style.  Don't let the sketchy neighborhood stop you.  Worth the trip from the strip.

Unfortunately I do not get to this side of town too often, otherwise it would be my regular breakfast spot. 
Bagel mania is the real deal, if you love NY/Jewish deli's then Bagelmania is your place. Moving from Los Angeles I missed my Canters's & Jerry's deli. The cookies are also awesome!
Great service, fresh bagels, great prices. Come here and take a refreshing break from the strip. Next to the 7/11.
Best bagels and breakfast in town. 3 minutes East of the strip. New York style bagels. Very friendly and plenty of parking. Had eggs and bagels. Must try this place if you haven't been yet.

We went here for breakfast one day to try and get away from the super pricey meals on the strip. Plus the hubby really wanted a bagel!

The waiter was so nice and friendly, and the place was full when we got there, so that is always a good sign. 

I had the brisket sandwich, it was ok, definitely lacked salt. It came ice cold, and I wondered if that was the Las Vegas way of eating it. The waiter assured me that it was not. My husband ordered the corned beef hash with scrambled eggs. The eggs were not cooked through and had some raw, runny spots. The waiter was apologetic and returned it to the "chef". He completely copped an attitude, and actually started complaining about us to the waiter and someone else behind the counter! Dude, we are sitting right here, and can hear you!

Anyway the hash was different than we are used to, but it was still good. Everything lacked salt, but I guess I'd rather have to add, than deal with too much. I would give it another try.

Unbelievable customer service!! We were visiting from out of state for a hockey tournament and our final game was running long - we were going to miss our mandatory stop on the way home. One phone call asking if they might be cleaning up and let us stop in for our order was all it took. They were incredibly kind and accommodating- I can't tell you how refreshing that is!! We love this place and we HIGHLY recommend to everyone!
Best bagels I've ever had.  And the breakfasts?  Huge and delicious!  The surroundings are a little down market, but that is more than made up for by the quality of the food and the friendly service!

I stopped by for a lox bagel with cream cheese to-go this morning before work. It was delicious ( a little greasy) and came with olives. They seem to have a lot of breakfast regulars from the east coast.
